commit_message:
[WIP] Add network-create to server side

Add network-create to server side, so that zun have the ability to
mange the network based on the kuryr driver.

Change-Id: Ifdd8804280bc015d93888efc77afecc72ec77cff

commit_message:
Add 'useful image properties' document

Move the list of useful image properties from the glanceclient
docs to the Glance Admin Guide.  It makes more sense in the Glance
docs as the only connection they have with the glanceclient is that
you can use the client CLI to set these properties

The table of property keys/values is unchanged; the introductory
section is new.

Change-Id: I0c307a067490c06728b5adf70c91586254e337da
Needed-by: https://review.openstack.org/565782

commit_message:
Copy-in neutron cert via kolla extended/start

Instead of bind-mounting in RW mode, follow the established
approach for ditributing certificates in containers.

Related-Bug: #1759049
Partial-Bug: #1767998

Change-Id: I6bcb72b8b600b6b1d916b64c161bca22c802cf07
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.
Co-Authored-By: wu.chunyang <wu.chunyang@99cloud.net>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I179b62101783777cdbcc19e602e49e32e405ea31

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I592f609123ab986f0fedc736648f1b10f1316c41

commit_message:
Add --validate-only to openstack overcloud node import

Previously there was 'openstack baremetal instackenv validate' to
quickly validate an environment file.

Much of which is now done in the validate_nodes mistral workflow.  Add a
mode to cease operations after validating the environment file

Note on the backport:
The old command was removed in Queens, so we need to backport this
new flag to fill in the gap. The workflow was introduced in Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1768604
Change-Id: Ie2bfc79b45f4652285718be34a5e07ce5777c60d
(cherry picked from commit ebc64b681cbd0e760d34b1dcc268f3b487a051e8)

commit_message:
Change host list display value

This patch add disk_total in host list display,
and delete os and labels in host list display.
Whether the host is available can be determined
by CPU, memory, and disk. OS and labels not high
in the value available to the host.
Use "host-show" get host detail message, The os and
labels will display.

Change-Id: I6bd47ebb84855485c60bf079cc6cd6efe483c814
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[DNM] Enable FK for unit tests by default

Once all tests can be passed with fk, we may remove the
enable fk switch.

This patch is used for tracing the fail test when
fk is eaabled.

Change-Id: I32d772faaeb01bbf06c34f20fa438faf91f63aa4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 17:43:09.000000000', 'message': "Workaround CellDatabase fixture limitation when creating computes

There is a limitation in the CellDatabase fixture when starting
compute services in different cells such that when the
ResourceTracker creates the ComputeNode for the first time, it's
using a non-targeted context, so the CellDatbase fixture will create
the ComputeNode record in the default cell, which is generally cell1.

If a test is trying to create a compute service in another cell, cell2
for example, the ComputeNode will still get created in the default
cell1, which will make any tests fail that rely on that second compute
service host to be in cell2.

This hacks around that limitation a bit when creating a compute service
with a specific cell in the base TestCase code by temporarily mutating
the CellDatabase fixture to point at the targeted cell while creating
the compute service.

Change-Id: Ia480d0eddffdcf639df488e7f87a265114a373ff
"}, {'created': '2018-01-02 23:45:38.000000000', 'message': "Workaround CellDatabase fixture limitation when creating computes

There is a limitation in the CellDatabase fixture when starting
compute services in different cells such that when the
ResourceTracker creates the ComputeNode for the first time, it's
using a non-targeted context, so the CellDatbase fixture will create
the ComputeNode record in the default cell, which is generally cell1.

If a test is trying to create a compute service in another cell, cell2
for example, the ComputeNode will still get created in the default
cell1, which will make any tests fail that rely on that second compute
service host to be in cell2.

This hacks around that limitation a bit when creating a compute service
with a specific cell in the base TestCase code by temporarily mutating
the CellDatabase fixture to point at the targeted cell while creating
the compute service.

Change-Id: Ia480d0eddffdcf639df488e7f87a265114a373ff
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround CellDatabase fixture limitation when creating computes

There is a limitation in the CellDatabase fixture when starting
compute services in different cells such that when the
ResourceTracker creates the ComputeNode for the first time, it's
using a non-targeted context, so the CellDatbase fixture will create
the ComputeNode record in the default cell, which is generally cell1.

If a test is trying to create a compute service in another cell, cell2
for example, the ComputeNode will still get created in the default
cell1, which will make any tests fail that rely on that second compute
service host to be in cell2.

This hacks around that limitation a bit when creating a compute service
with a specific cell in the base TestCase code by temporarily mutating
the CellDatabase fixture to point at the targeted cell while creating
the compute service.

Change-Id: Ia480d0eddffdcf639df488e7f87a265114a373ff

commit_message:
Restrict tenant network to geneve

OVN doesn't support VXLAN networks. VLAN tenant networks
have limitations and should be blocked till they are fixed.
So we restrict tenant network to geneve.

Change-Id: I4cabde39c252a605d769e137ae402f6fbc5a3041
Closes-Bug: 1767070
(cherry picked from commit ae4aac8cb57a69d82c35e90090d52f5b30b335a6)

commit_message:
ifcfg: don't restart ovs if --no-activate is specified

When --no-activate is specified, there is a chance that
openvswitch service will still be restarted if dpdk port
configuration file is changed. This adds a condition to
check activate and restart openvswitch only if activate
is true.

Change-Id: Ia5a6d04eb26cc3a6e10caacb8256d6e2d183239e
Closes-Bug: #1751955
Resolves: rhbz#1572668
(cherry picked from commit a330929f7708b50944e0a3bdb64b3d22c8815db0)

commit_message:
Fixes to match Horizon Rocky

Horizon in Rocky 'fixed' recursive inheritance but this
in turn broke our use of overextends. As such we drop
overextends for Rocky onwards, but this means Adjutant-UI
from Rocky onwards only works with Horizon from Rocky onwards.

This also fixes issues with quota naming cleanup which was
changed in Horizon proper.

Change-Id: I60fa4e8e751bb62760830e37775c42b9900fb59c

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I8291a00f95a256e4455e066dde20c3bb178126c6

'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Change-Id: I6fc6e784dd96c9e82986cc6c515e5e93553a78c5

commit_message:
add --ignore-single-vendor flag

Add a special flag for single-vendor, so folks don't have to remember
the exact tag name.

Change-Id: Ic3caf6e91228b67a4563b4a65d89c5961be17073
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
clean up run script

Use .dat instead of .csv for the raw data to make it easier to find
those files for one-off processing.

Add comments about what each step is doing and clean up the
formatting.

Change-Id: I159f745752383e37b734276bfa75bff7fb1aa9be
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support skipping some teams in summaries

This is useful for building a picture of the work done in stable
branches because we can ignore the deployment projects, which
typically have a lot of work done, and focus on the other projects
which have much lower volume of changes.

Change-Id: I4e83727606dcaab36c0697d5caf3f15371f126cb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
organize governance data structure for faster access

Most of the lookups are done by repository name, so build a data
structure indexed directly on those values.

Change-Id: I60a0fbd3fbf91718115121fb56f32cda2c3defca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
handle missing reviewer fields

Some review data does not include the email, so return a bogus value
in that case. Handle the name the same way while we're at it.

Change-Id: I50d385d6c3b2683387388e055b411f2dc8c277a4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add missing check for gnocchi api enabled

If gnocchi api is not enabled, the db sync cannot be run, as
it will fail due to an invalid config file.

Change-Id: If08b3ef4c87f501cf7fff690441351c74ebc4c98

subject: Set ironic_log_dir so that logs are written to /var/log/ironic
messages:
[{'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-03-04 23:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-03-04 23:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Herm...

"IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/log/ironic/ironic-dbsync.log'"

Which I didn't catch testing locally because I was upgrading an existing install, not bootstrapping a new one.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-05 10:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Perhaps the default of not logging to a file is intentional. The log collection script used at the end of CI runs (scripts/collect-test-info.sh) does this to collect logs:

    sudo journalctl -u ironic-api &> ${LOG_LOCATION}/ironic-api.log
    sudo journalctl -u ironic-conductor &> ${LOG_LOCATION}/ironic-conductor.log
    sudo journalctl -u ironic-inspector &> ${LOG_LOCATION}/ironic-inspector.log

I made the change [1] to make the log location configurable, which maintained the default behaviour of not setting log_dir. Perhaps the README could have been worded better.

Ultimately I don't mind changing the default behaviour to log to files as I typically do this anyway. I'll let others weigh in though - there may have been a good reason.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/7b29f145e8bc355f7b8c6ae40686b952a6811db5"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-06 10:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

An ansible task to create the logging directory, if this does not exist, will be needed in case you want to provide some defaults for the logging path'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-05-03 00:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-04 23:17:17.000000000', 'message': "Set ironic_log_dir so that logs are written to /var/log/ironic

The null value doesn't write logs to the default location like the
README though. We just drop those logs on the floor instead. Let's
fix this by just having the default write to the correct place.

Change-Id: I093790a90952ba3a91b12e0f24b2473dbce34659
"}]
commit_message:
Set ironic_log_dir so that logs are written to /var/log/ironic

The null value doesn't write logs to the default location like the
README though. We just drop those logs on the floor instead. Let's
fix this by just having the default write to the correct place.

Change-Id: I093790a90952ba3a91b12e0f24b2473dbce34659

like. This review is for comment.

commit_message:
Simplify the code in s3api

At least now you know that the "with" clause isn't modifying
a self.something behind your back.

The affected part was added when migrating from swift3 to s3api.
As a bonus, the patch makes the code slightly more similar to
the original.

Change-Id: Id4bfbaf971e3a08fdf9d0ef8d7373bb36c298682

commit_message:
Small cleanup on s3api

This patch is one of follow up to remove unnecessary
files, and a comment in the code.

The conf files are used to setup functests environment
in the past swift3 repository but that should port to
setuppers of functests (see related change). Anyway,
we don't need shell based older conf.in script on that way.

Change-Id: If431979ea6fa373ac1cde4b7e13d57d91fb15be8
Related-Change: I6f30f74678ad35479da237361bee48c46c0ecc49

commit_message:
Only install libvirt-python and python-lxml via pip

These are required by the ansible net_virt module, and also virtualbmc.
As such, they will be upgraded when virtualbmc is installed. Pip 10 will
not allow this, if are already installed by the system package manager.
Let's only ever install them via pip as that's the version we want in
the end anyway.

Change-Id: Ia209f22170905a5acd23eeb82cbdec9a537bf80b

commit_message:
Add sudo into instack's semanage call.

When having a file with incorrect SELinux context
in /home/stac/.ssh a permission error is displayed
at the time of running semanage during Pike to
Queens undercloud upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1767405
Change-Id: I994917e491d6f8b4141a3c332c79ed8e8ce8e64c
(cherry picked from commit a96a0239cf36d2c51d18335ab1800bb73dc8e171)

commit_message:
Use queens version of dependencies

Use queens release of:

* Kolla
* Kolla ansible
* Bifrost
* IPA
* OpenStack services

Changes to kolla inventory files were made by comparing the multinode
inventory in kolla-ansible with the overcloud-services and
overcloud-components templates.

Kolla ansible added the concept of inner-compute and external-compute,
and these groups have been added to the top-level inventory.

We also synchronise globals.yml and kolla enablement flags.

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I400d4acf93ab634683cd9c4b05db7c79a51810be

subject: Set swift_owner for requests from InternalClient
messages: [{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-02 18:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 18:45:34.000000000', 'message': "Set swift_owner for requests from InternalClient

A coworker of mine was trying to use InternalClient to copy account
metadata from one account to another, but the tempurl keys never made
it across. This is because they're in the proxy's list of
swift_owner_headers, which it will not show to anyone without the
'swift_owner' field set in the environment. An InternalClient has
pretty much full access to everything, so it makes no sense to give it
everything except tempurl keys.

This commit makes InternalClient set swift_owner by default. You can
still turn it off if you need to.

Change-Id: If9c30dfea150b51e3454abd1fa0a5d51dc6ad224
"}]
commit_message:
Set swift_owner for requests from InternalClient

A coworker of mine was trying to use InternalClient to copy account
metadata from one account to another, but the tempurl keys never made
it across. This is because they're in the proxy's list of
swift_owner_headers, which it will not show to anyone without the
'swift_owner' field set in the environment. An InternalClient has
pretty much full access to everything, so it makes no sense to give it
everything except tempurl keys.

This commit makes InternalClient set swift_owner by default. You can
still turn it off if you need to.

Change-Id: If9c30dfea150b51e3454abd1fa0a5d51dc6ad224

commit_message:
Add CephMgr service to custom roles_data file.

In commit 3cea68f12cd954282a824936922f58768aef5042 new service,
 CephMgr was introduced.
This change add validation for this service to be present in a
 custom roles_data file, and adds it if missing.
This prevents error during ceph upgrade, for e.g.:
 Please add a mgr host to your inventory.

Closes-Bug: 1767304
Change-Id: Iab18f8125a07b20def5bfb22f2ccf0dcbc5ec0ac

commit_message:
fs001: enable cleaning, disable inspection extras

Ironic node cleaning is an important feature, required for Ceph deployments.
This change makes fs001 run automated cleaning before deployment.

To compensate for the increased gate run time, inspection extras are disabled.
They are covered by fs035 (and other featuresets with introspection).

Depends-On: I0145b3731ee63b6b05f79706c9ec90a14c1b06e6
Change-Id: I876ee678e0d56bef68867c0aeca882e784d0e835

when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why

for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered

commit_message:
Don't unregister on system/resource delete

Don't unregister systems from the portal/satellite
when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why
it's compelling to fix this behavior. See
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1710144
for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered
by setting the DeleteOnRHELUnregistration parameter to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1710144
Change-Id: I909a6f7a049dc23fc27f2231a4893d428f06a1f1
(cherry picked from commit 35ed6c6065b1e263eb69725e71639a6ea6d54cc7)

commit_message:
Workflows for wiping overcloud nodes

A replacement of automated cleaning, which we disable by default.
Introduces workflows to clean (fully or metadata only) given or
all manageable nodes.

Change-Id: I909aad89bb18bb416e9749395970617d45b247ee

a mechanism so that they can be downloaded.

commit_message:
Revert Ceph bridge names to previous values

When the NIC configs were unified under a single role.role.j2.yaml,
the bridge name for Ceph roles was changed from "br-storage" or
"br-bond" to "br-ex". This breaks upgrades which used the original
NIC config templates. This change reverts those valuse when
rendering the NIC config templates for CephStorage roles.

Closes-Bug: #1766748
Change-Id: I68b6e674d6aa86aa7d60efa3eb7b3cb874171e63
(cherry picked from commit 8e20095f4424000d829b6d4b3404ef23ed6814f9)

[{'created': '2018-05-01 22:07:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sample env data

I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0 renamed the rabbit ssl
parameters that we use in the same environment generate but since the
script did not fail, it made it past CI. This change fixes the
RabbitClientUseSsl parameter in the environment to match the new

again.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix sample env data

I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0 renamed the rabbit ssl
parameters that we use in the same environment generate but since the
script did not fail, it made it past CI. This change fixes the
RabbitClientUseSsl parameter in the environment to match the new
RpcUseSsl flag and updates the check script to fail if this happens
again.

Change-Id: I47c63875c6934bca2903883787467fc1804ba5da
Closes-Bug: #1768358

commit_message:
Subject: Remove inactive working groups

In preperation for the 2018 Vancouver summit, the UC is cleaning up the lists
of teams and working groups in order to better prepare for reserving BOF space
for these groups.

Tue Apr 10: Removed additional group that is now a SIG

Change-Id: I712b3e6179e5e577a88f0c266ecb272c061f681d

commit_message:
undercloud: don't include config-download env

Since I8389a0c48e1aa610fdc6a8580516889340883034 it's the default so we
don't need to include this environment. Also, this env is deprecated in
Rocky so we don't want it anymore.

Change-Id: I36cc547b41b5b407e8ebfedd7167962f15847284

subject: Setting YEAR variable will reduce time to pull eavesdrop logs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 612, 'name': 'Tom Fifield', 'email': 'tom@openstack.org', 'username': 'fifieldt'}, {'_account_id': 704, 'name': 'Edgar Magana', 'email': 'emagana@gmail.com', 'username': 'emagana'}, {'_account_id': 4625, 'name': 'Jonathan Proulx', 'email': 'jon@jonproulx.com', 'username': 'jproulx'}, {'_account_id': 9382, 'name': 'Shilla Saebi', 'email': 'shilla.saebi@gmail.com', 'username': 'shillasaebi'}, {'_account_id': 12651, 'name': 'Shamail Tahir', 'email': 'ItzShamail@gmail.com', 'username': 'shamail'}, {'_account_id': 17556, 'name': 'Melvin Hillsman', 'email': 'mrhillsman@gmail.com', 'username': 'mrhillsman'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2017-06-22 17:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-22 17:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/44/476644/1/check/noop/572dfe7/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2017-06-27 10:36:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is a good idea - no point downloading data we don't need :)

However, if merged as is - this will break the automated AUC machinery for people whose AUC status is from a previous year. That's basically because get_active_wg_members.py assumes that all the data is present in the data dir.

You can see how it's called at:

https://github.com/OpenStackweb/openstack-org/blob/master/auc-metrics/code/services/ActiveUserCommitteeWorkingGroupsService.php#L66

So, we have a choice as to where we implement the year-limiting logic:
* In this script, get_meeting_data.sh, just add a loop that is current year + previous year
* In the AUC automation service, ActiveUserCommitteeWorkingGroupsService.php, to  run get_meeting_data.sh twice, once for current year and once for previous year.

Preference?"}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2017-07-01 05:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think it makes sense for the logic to be in the .sh file; possibly accepting a flag like -c for current only and if not all?'}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2017-07-01 05:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2017-07-03 14:58:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure thing :)

Thinking about our use cases, I guess most of them can be satisfied with YEAR && YEAR-1. Maybe we should make that the default behaviour? The current automation would work fine with that, and it'd limit a lot of unnecessary old stuff."}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2017-07-03 15:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow

Great idea, since you definitely know the use-cases, totally agree with it being default behavior.'}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2018-05-02 19:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Signed-off-by: Melvin Hillsman <mrhillsman@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Report libvirt failures as IPMI-retryable

It seems that at times of high concurrency, libvirt
occassionally fails on supposedly some race condition
what leads to client failure (e.g. Ironic). This change
is to tell Ironic that it should try some more times rather
than bailing out right away.

Change-Id: I5848d721305c887fb7803ca4b302565aa4b83c88
Story: #2001798
Task: #15076

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 01:29:43.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Retry dhcp_release on failures

Sometimes calls to dhcp_release(6) do not result in removal
of a lease from the lease file, for example, when the release
packet is not received by dnsmasq.  Trying more than once is
recommended in this case.

Instead of blindly trying some number of times, we monitor
the lease file contents, and retry the dhcp_release(6) call
when an entry still remains.  This is possible since
dhcp_release(6) is being run from the DHCP server itself.
We try three times and wait 0.5 seconds between tries.

Change-Id: Ic1864f7efbc94db1369ac7f3e2879fda86f95a11
Closes-bug: #tobefiled
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 16:48:49.000000000', 'message': 'Retry dhcp_release on failures

commit_message:
Retry dhcp_release on failures

Sometimes calls to dhcp_release(6) do not result in removal
of a lease from the leases file, for example, when the release
packet is not received by dnsmasq.  Trying more than once is
recommended in this case.

Instead of blindly trying some number of times, we monitor
the lease file contents, and retry the dhcp_release(6) call
when an entry still remains.  This is possible since
dhcp_release(6) is being run from the DHCP server itself.
We try three times and wait 0.3 seconds between tries.

We also now check for any stale leases in the leases file
that are unknown to neutron, also trying to remove them.

Change-Id: Ic1864f7efbc94db1369ac7f3e2879fda86f95a11
Closes-bug: #1764481

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I391c779e4692d5de526dfda035843b8f5e267a75

commit_message:
Remove ExactCoreFilter ExactDiskFilter ExactRamFilter

ExactCoreFilter, ExactDiskFilter and ExactRamFilter were deprecated
for removal in the Pike release [1] and are now being removed.

Now scheduling will use the custom resource class defined for each
baremetal node to make its selection.

[1] I843353427c90142a366ae9ca63ee4298b4f3ecd4

Change-Id: Ie25a5f6c28c20f589016791970da8d5849ec291c

[{'created': '2018-04-26 12:35:34.000000000', 'message': "Switch rally trunk scenario to use new rally validators

Validators like:
* rally.task.validation.required_openstack
* rally.task.validation.required_services
are deprecated in Rally 0.10.0 [1].

Instead of calling it directly they should be used via
new decorator 'rally.common.validation.add' and this commit
switches it to use validators in new way.

[1] https://tinyurl.com/y94sfct2

Change-Id: I2883eb94e2532a10160305b283e2d64b93443909
"}]
commit_message:
Switch rally trunk scenario to use new rally validators

Validators like:
* rally.task.validation.required_openstack
* rally.task.validation.required_services
are deprecated in Rally 0.10.0 [1].

Instead of calling it directly they should be used via
new decorator 'rally.common.validation.add' and this commit
switches it to use validators in new way.

[1] https://tinyurl.com/y94sfct2

Change-Id: I2883eb94e2532a10160305b283e2d64b93443909

commit_message:
Add support to override http/https port

Adds support to override the http and/or https
ports that is passed down to the horizon::wsgi::apache
class. No default values has been changed.

Change-Id: I57fd5f3a433c6e123aa0f531630941fabf6ea721
Closes-Bug: 1210719

commit_message:
Add fedora-latest nodeset and ozj jobs

Fedora-28 is the latest release, this adds our fedora-latest nodeset
which jobs will now use. This will minimize the number of zuul.yaml
changes moving forward, as we can just update this nodeset.

Change-Id: I89f395aee1885bd24215f847af01ca9dc79bfa4d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565758
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix root_url bug when using a slash

When settings the root_url to a slash the
paths in the local_settings.py and apache config
will be wrong. This patch fixes that issue.

Change-Id: Ib64b22bb88b2827ea4be2eb8356aa404984ee0ba
Closes-Bug: 1651720

subject: add --highlight-sponsors option to contributor report commands
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-02 18:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-02 18:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-02 18:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 18:22:44.000000000', 'message': 'add --highlight-sponsors option to contributor report commands

When the option is specified contributions from organizations that are
not sponsors are combined into a single "*other" result to preserve
the overall relative contribution levels of the remaining companies
but to limit the number of names returned in the output.

The default is to show all sponsors, but a --sponsor-level option can
change that to specify only platinum or gold members.

Change-Id: I3062dc607ee2f35a73cfc2237a8f9c58df78af8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 18:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'add --highlight-sponsors option to contributor report commands

When the option is specified contributions from organizations that are
not sponsors are combined into a single "*other" result to preserve
the overall relative contribution levels of the remaining companies
but to limit the number of names returned in the output.

The default is to show all sponsors, but a --sponsor-level option can
change that to specify only platinum or gold members.

Change-Id: I3062dc607ee2f35a73cfc2237a8f9c58df78af8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add --highlight-sponsors option to contributor report commands

When the option is specified contributions from organizations that are
not sponsors are combined into a single "*other" result to preserve
the overall relative contribution levels of the remaining companies
but to limit the number of names returned in the output.

The default is to show all sponsors, but a --sponsor-level option can
change that to specify only platinum or gold members.

Change-Id: I3062dc607ee2f35a73cfc2237a8f9c58df78af8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add timer services

Systemd provides for "timers" which is replacing cron. This change
implements timers as an option to any created service.

Change-Id: I8fdca58fcb43726560521c7c25f7e57cfb61353b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 15:14:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add basic provisioning using pxelinux

The basic provisioning tools we had in the MNAIO could long be used on a
set of physical machines however doing so required a healthy
understanding of everything going on under the hood. This change
extracts the PXE components out of our older MNAIO tooling and
will allow operators to easily deploy operating systems on machines in
the most compatible way possible.

Change-Id: I2188f0f0de7f8be331a35b5f22cf5114ea9b6718
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

understanding of everything going on under the hood. This change
extracts the PXE components out of our older MNAIO tooling and
will allow operators to easily deploy operating systems on machines in

Change-Id: I2188f0f0de7f8be331a35b5f22cf5114ea9b6718
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add basic provisioning using pxelinux

The basic provisioning tools we had in the MNAIO could long be used on a
set of physical machines however doing so required a healthy
understanding of everything going on under the hood. This change
extracts the PXE components out of our older MNAIO tooling and
will allow operators to easily deploy operating systems on machines in
the most compatible way possible.

Change-Id: I2188f0f0de7f8be331a35b5f22cf5114ea9b6718
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add curator and dynamic shard counts

Curator has been added to automatically maintain the cluster with
sensible defaults when it pertains to data retention.

The index counts have been modified such that they're determined by the
size of the initial cluster. While these shard counts can be modified
post deployment by reindexing the data, it's not something being done at
this time.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/c/565807
Change-Id: I249d715ae5241ab57c4117b14377e4d07cb6e984
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix Dogtag mode on key generation
messages: [{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-04-27 20:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-04-30 14:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 20:37:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix Dogtag mode on key generation

Dogtag doesn't actually need the mode parameter to be
stored in metadata.  We remove it from the generation case
because passing back a None value for the metadata breaks
metadata validation.

Added a functional test for no value passed in for the mode
in the order request.

Change-Id: I216f887875b1306604dd370301ac463cccbb2fa9
(cherry picked from commit 0861657fc1ea2d04faad2b7180fae0d0e59fb09c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Dogtag mode on key generation

Dogtag doesn't actually need the mode parameter to be
stored in metadata.  We remove it from the generation case
because passing back a None value for the metadata breaks
metadata validation.

Added a functional test for no value passed in for the mode
in the order request.

Change-Id: I216f887875b1306604dd370301ac463cccbb2fa9
(cherry picked from commit 0861657fc1ea2d04faad2b7180fae0d0e59fb09c)

commit_message:
Do not filter pools by attributes when non are provided

This change stops the AttributeFilter from filtering when no
attributes were provided.

This also removes the pool_id attribte from the request, as this
is used in a different filter.

Change-Id: If57d81e0343fa442828da7390bf20249f4791861

commit_message:
Change package name for OVN metadata agent

The right package name is python-networking-ovn-metadata-agent,
not networking-ovn-metadata-agent.

Change-Id: I278ad5521c9529e5bd71f712c44c6a69f485d1b6
(cherry picked from commit a0ca5f1b4d6f252099ec7f35cfb3ce5527128143)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 21:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'openstacklib::openstackclient wrong and hardcoded package name

The package name for the openstackclient was hardcoded
in the openstacklib::openstackclient class which caused
it to fail on RedHat based operating systems since the
package name there is python2-openstackclient.

The previous state worked fine on Ubuntu deployments, this
now fixes so this class supports Debian as well where the
package name is named python3-openstackclient.

Change-Id: I8a0c5dfa9274dca167ad3bb33ab151fb693f5d4d
Closes-Bug: 1766357
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 21:32:38.000000000', 'message': 'openstacklib::openstackclient wrong and hardcoded package name

The package name for the openstackclient was hardcoded
in the openstacklib::openstackclient class which caused
it to fail on RedHat based operating systems since the
package name there is python2-openstackclient.

The previous state worked fine on Ubuntu deployments, this
now fixes so this class supports Debian as well where the
package name is named python3-openstackclient.

Change-Id: I8a0c5dfa9274dca167ad3bb33ab151fb693f5d4d
Closes-Bug: 1766357
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 11:53:20.000000000', 'message': 'openstacklib::openstackclient Debian python3

Change-Id: I8a0c5dfa9274dca167ad3bb33ab151fb693f5d4d

commit_message:
openstacklib::openstackclient Debian python3

This change adds support for installing the
python3-openstackclient package on Debian.

On Ubuntu and RedHat based the package name
is still python-openstackclient.

Change-Id: I8a0c5dfa9274dca167ad3bb33ab151fb693f5d4d

instead.

commit_message:
Add Ceph upgrade tasks

Ceph upgrade is done with dedicated command.
This change adds tasks to create ceph upgrade scripts and
perform actual ceph upgrade.
Ceph upgrade would be run just in case ceph_osd service is present
in the list stack's enabled services

Change-Id: I67ade3ffc06ea839cf05ce42c4421d2a850570a3

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie3cf59a181b8ccd2ccbaf88c70a56cc35de178d2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

I'm not strongly against that, because it's something we need to do, but the approach taken is wrong.

These certificates should be generated on the deploy node, using ansible modules if possible, and should then be published on the remote nodes.

The generation can take some default assumptions (and it's fine for me), but these assumptions should be in line with what we currently have."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-21 17:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-21 19:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-21 20:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-22 04:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-22 18:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-23 04:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-23 04:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-23 05:03:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Adds certificate generation

This will generate self-signed certificates needed
for Octavia during install.

Change-Id: I39bbc4c43633b844b55f463723ba1b72d79fd206

commit_message:
Add --validate-only to openstack overcloud node import

Previously there was 'openstack baremetal instackenv validate' to
quickly validate an environment file.

Much of which is now done in the validate_nodes mistral workflow.  Add a
mode to cease operations after validating the environment file

Change-Id: Ie2bfc79b45f4652285718be34a5e07ce5777c60d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 16:52:08.000000000', 'message': 'Move API (functional) tests to separate jobs

It becomes increasingly harder to maintain functional tests using the fake
hardware type and integration tests in the same jobs. This change creates
two new jobs (for Python 2 and Python 3) and makes API tests run only in them.

Change-Id: I3570323b22d8d4f19635f26733b3ae92bd0c661d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 17:01:00.000000000', 'message': 'Move API (functional) tests to separate jobs

It becomes increasingly harder to maintain functional tests using the fake

commit_message:
Move API (functional) tests to separate jobs

It becomes increasingly harder to maintain functional tests using the fake
hardware type and integration tests in the same jobs. This change creates
two new jobs (for Python 2 and Python 3) and makes API tests run only in them.

Change-Id: I3570323b22d8d4f19635f26733b3ae92bd0c661d

commit_message:
Resync charmhelpers

This picks up a change in charm-helpers to re-add the
source of /etc/network/interfaces.d/* that Juju drops
from /etc/network/interfaces, supporting the use of
a Juju created bridge for north/south traffic routing.

Change-Id: Ia3fd69bbe05834a88b705c63a7312897ae9d8a5c

commit_message:
Fix the ceph-mgr connect to cluster failed

For luminous, the ceph_mgr service provide the
dashborad for ceph, and it need connect to cluster,
but now it failed to connect ceph cluster due to
ceph.client.admin.keyring missing, this ps to fix it.

Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>
Closes-Bug: #1768462

Change-Id: Idb24661bc5674780db390220ca02e22975490663

@Andrea, the error shows packages version conflicts: os-testr>=1.0.0 is required by tempest 17.1.0, while the upper-constraints in openstack/requirements requires os-testr===0.8.2. 
Do you have any idea about this?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so you are increasing the pike capped version of tempest which is totally fine as tempest is branchless and all version should work with supported stable branches. 

But dependent pckg has to be upper consternation according to new tempest version.   

For current error, you have to update upper constraint for os-testr also to os-testr===1.0.0 that is also fine as os-testr also branchless.'}, {'account_id': 26088, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26088, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26088, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Update constraint for tempest to 17.1.0

Tempest 17.0.0 contains one bug about volume client v2/v3,
which has been fixed by tempest 17.1.0, see:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/4f0887c4f2cf484cd77118b86690dd2826ae9961#diff-21d4d605bf90d705c36f808dd12f8aab

Change-Id: I904f002918585c403631f397dc2dcb66e8c7b4b3
Signed-off-by: Linda Wang <wangwulin@huawei.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-19 07:46:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix assert test error under py3.6

The function __str__ of class subprocess.CalledProcessError
is different between py3.6 and lower python version.

        py3.6: Command '%s' returned non-zero exit status %d.
lower version: Command '%s' returned non-zero exit status %d

There is a . in py3.6.

This patch fix the assert error under py3.6

Change-Id: I19ae5711ed7440791583940fa4a8fb770dcdc933
Closes-bug: #1751551
"}, {'created': '2018-03-20 06:56:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix assert test error under py3.6

"}]
commit_message:
Fix assert test error under py3.6

The function __str__ of class subprocess.CalledProcessError
is different between py3.6 and lower python version.

        py3.6: Command '%s' returned non-zero exit status %d.
lower version: Command '%s' returned non-zero exit status %d

There is a . in py3.6.

This patch fix the assert error under py3.6

Change-Id: I19ae5711ed7440791583940fa4a8fb770dcdc933
Closes-bug: #1751551
(cherry picked from commit 4a1df081fd3868a75bfabe8099025069eb42248f)

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: Iac0fe4a42647781e314f613b59e4e76e8ce7a975

commit_message:
Move Nova Compute undercloud upgrade logic into nova-ironic

NovaIronic service is deployed on the undercloud, not NovaCompute, so we
need to run the teardown tasks in NovaIronic otherwise nova-compute will
never be stopped during an upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifd65ff55c525abd5d27f4920b115fe32b69dbb9c

[{'created': '2018-05-02 05:09:52.000000000', 'message': "Ensure tasks aren't empty dicts

Ansible doesn't like it when tasks are empty dicts so let's make sure
we aren't passing an empty dict in to the ansible tasks. Unfortunately
since we're validating non-heat processed yaml, the list_concats end
up being dicts to the yaml validator so we can't just ensure they are
always lists.

Change-Id: I13dcc4f3d4ea2ac4c7ab62887dfea293246f6530
Related-Bug: #1768019
(cherry picked from commit 960fc05b8a6f1ebd4d5fad6c216eb0fc2ea46f8f)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure tasks aren't empty dicts

Ansible doesn't like it when tasks are empty dicts so let's make sure
we aren't passing an empty dict in to the ansible tasks. Unfortunately
since we're validating non-heat processed yaml, the list_concats end
up being dicts to the yaml validator so we can't just ensure they are
always lists.

Change-Id: I13dcc4f3d4ea2ac4c7ab62887dfea293246f6530
Related-Bug: #1768019
(cherry picked from commit 960fc05b8a6f1ebd4d5fad6c216eb0fc2ea46f8f)

commit_message:
Introduce docker_insecure_registries parameter

Introduce docker_insecure_registries that is an array of host/port
combiniations of docker insecure registries. The default value will
be the previous parameter that were hardcoded, but now we can easily
override it in undercloud.conf.

Note: the feature is already supported for the containerized undercloud
but was only missing in instack-undercloud. This patch will be
backported.

Depends-On: I14fda3481ac88429648bed8edb2f4469b33be957
Change-Id: I402ebb80b1d755cdb0c3c28fd542121bc60cb144
Closes-Bug: #1767373
(cherry picked from commit 2ee1ebfd34d72a91311ed7683c272b070fde61ea)

commit_message:
Add parameter for UndercloudNetConfigOverride

This can be used to inject a custom Json blob containing
os-net-config template data for the Undercloud installation.
The intent is to be able to use this alongside of the
net_config_override setting in tripleoclient when installing
the undercloud.

Change-Id: I322570ae958f8e483b8b2a0ad40d1ee83d084372

commit_message:
undercloud-deploy: allow configuring inspection_extras and clean_nodes

This adds support for two variables:
* undercloud_clean_nodes - whether to enable ironic node cleaning
  (default is false).
* undercloud_inspection_extras - whether to use extended introspection,
  including LLDP and full inventory (default is true).

Change-Id: I0145b3731ee63b6b05f79706c9ec90a14c1b06e6

commit_message:
Add DeployIdentifier to Swift set_swift_secret container

Resolves an issue during scale out where the Swift set_swift_secret
container that sets the required Barbican key ID wasn't executing on a
Heat stack update if the container name and configs all stayed the same.

commit_message:
Explicitly set nova/neutron/ceilometer host to expected fqdn

This avoids any issues where the host/domainname is altered by a DHCP lease.
Also the puppet/facter fqdn can be unpredictable when there are multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I7ed52727d1515ee7f191a82b0b1d645a9d597cd3
Closes-bug: 1758034
(cherry picked from commit 31e4c0194dd1d6e049a728c876347df93ce89908)
(cherry picked from commit 3381d59f0a6bafac47c98ed8754ee4170e749354)
(cherry picked from commit c48ae0b42f06dacd8615ef52f718674ec95c12af)

commit_message:
Create /var/log/containers on Swift storage-only nodes

This directory is missing when deploying standalone Swift storage nodes,
and thus the following Ansible task to create a link fails.

Closes-Bug: 1736109
Change-Id: If09f3b9942e4f44e398563c044e9c70101fef367
(cherry picked from commit d76092184e16ba8081bd82acb577949c56435682)

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the package_update workbook

Update the package_update workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Related-Bug: #1757372
Change-Id: Ibe26fe2fda1b2f0e27fd26a5f1111b8365662116

commit_message:
Honor endpoint_override for get_session_client

get_session_client is not passing endpoint_override settings to the
Adapter constructor causing the setting to be ignored. Pass the setting
in as a parameter.

Change-Id: I1e57579291a3943fca090100b43905f71b2daab4

commit_message:
Copy os-nova-servers from searchlight ui: actions

This patch adds the actions from searchlight ui to the instances
resource type.

Attempted to do so with as few changes to code as possible. Major
changes from searchlight ui:

- copied in searchlight ui's generic redirect action
- code test coverage was increased, resulting in some bug fixes
- initScope usage was replaced with initAction

The follow-on patch to remove this code from Searchlight UI is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450067/

Change-Id: I20c6e9ba7d69c5d215c1e0fb058da37c9b9533c1
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-instances-table

commit_message:
Copy os-nova-servers from searchlight ui: details pages

This patch adds details pages for the instances resource type.

The major change in this patch over the searchlight ui code:

- removed cleanTime filter from action-log controller since it
  did not match any documented response or observed data

The follow-on patch to remove this code from Searchlight UI is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450067/

Change-Id: Ic46d6e80d74dd61d78ed7146baa9b1fab78106ac
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-instances-table

@Richard, 
Tested some actions which are fine without the changes. Found some issues with the changes, please see the compiled list. 

Tested table actions on a running instance:
------------------------------------------
pause
Unpause
Suspend
Resume
Hard reboot
Soft reboot
Start
Stop
Delete

Issues: 
1. dialog comes up with spinning, once spinning is done, if the item is in the middle of the dropdown action list, the dropdown doesn't get closed. 
2. No inline progress bar and have to reload the table to show the status changed. 
3. No notification message.
4. Got error when delete instance : not allowed delete instance and the dialog keeps spinning



Tested overview actions on a running instance:
---------------------------------------------

Create snapshot
Edit Instance
Attach Volume
Detach Volume
Edit Instance
Edit Security Group
Pause instance
Suspend Instance 
Lock Instance
Unlock Instance
Soft Reboot Instance
Hard Reboot Instance
Shutoff Instance
Rebuild Instance
Delete Instance

Issues: 

1. Inconsistency after action is done:
After attached/detached a Volume, it goes to the instance table instead of staying at the detail page while other actions finish and stay at the detail page. 

2. Pause instance
Suspend Instance 
Lock Instance
Unlock Instance
Soft Reboot Instance
Hard Reboot Instance
Shutoff Instance
Delete Instance

got a blank page and an error in the f12 console : POST http://10.130.43.101:9877/project/instances/ 405 (METHOD NOT ALLOWED)

3. Rebuild Instance
No progress inline and need to reload table to show the status change

Questions and concerns: 

Why rest of the actions can only be accessed from more actions in table action dropdown to the actions dropdown in instance detail page? Why they cannot be part of the table actions? It is not very user friendly IMO. I assume it is the design of searchlight ui though.  

Tested Create Instance
------------------------

Issues: 
1. No progress inline and need to reload table to show status
2. Got error status...no error notification and not allowed to deleted it."}, {'account_id': 12071, 'date': '2017-04-06 06:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 12071, 'date': '2017-04-06 06:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Thanks for the review! I'm looking into the issues, but also decided to keep things easier for review I have split this patch into three parts: the table, the details pages and the actions. This patch is the first step to integrating the os-nova-servers

changes from searchlight ui:

- initScope usage was replaced with initAction

'}, {'created': '2017-03-16 01:00:52.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Copy os-nova-servers from searchlight ui

This patch is the first step to integrating the os-nova-servers
resource type code from searchlight ui into Horizon.

Attempted to do so with as few changes to code as possible. Major
changes from searchlight ui:

- angularjs module namespace moved from resource.os-nova-servers
  to horizon.app.core.instances
- copied in searchlight ui's generic redirect action
- hz-dynamic-table handling of sort column names was amended to
  allow for illegal JS property names
  (ie "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone" and co.)
- code test coverage was increased, resulting in some bug fixes
- initScope usage was replaced with initAction
- removed cleanTime filter from action-log controller since it

commit_message:
Copy os-nova-servers from searchlight ui

This patch is the first step to integrating the os-nova-servers
resource type code from searchlight ui into Horizon. It adds
the basic table.

Attempted to do so with as few changes to code as possible. Major
changes from searchlight ui:

- angularjs module namespace moved from resource.os-nova-servers
  to horizon.app.core.instances
- hz-dynamic-table handling of sort column names was amended to
  allow for illegal JS property names
  (ie "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone" and co.)
- code test coverage was increased, resulting in some bug fixes

The follow-on patch to remove this code from Searchlight UI is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450067/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Change-Id: I5769eda63d3fe708d12093bf805f79573c56345d
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-instances-table

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I2027d59faacd0c00bc3ebeb15782eacfc4a3ce9f

[{'created': '2018-03-31 22:34:01.000000000', 'message': "Update check to ensure compute is using placement

Previously we checked to ensure that compute is configured to use
placement by the presence of the placement.[os_]region_name option.
Since that option is not actually required, it's not appropriate
to fail when it's not set. Instead, we'll attempt to actually
access the placement service, and raise an appropriate exception if
we're unable to do so due to lack of auth configuration.

Change-Id: I973180d6a384b32838ab61d4e6aaf73c255fd116
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1751692

placement.[os_]region_name was not set. The check was not appropriate

commit_message:
Remove placement config check

Removes a check that prevented compute from starting when config option
placement.[os_]region_name was not set. The check was not appropriate
since that option is not (otherwise) required. The check was originally
added to catch upgrades to Ocata, where placement (newly) needed to be
configured. Since we're well past that point now, the check is no longer
necessary.

Change-Id: I973180d6a384b32838ab61d4e6aaf73c255fd116
Closes-Bug: 1751692

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I76f6c07bbb938d0eaeefc1bc9c8c383e2ca48e09

commit_message:
Stop supporting the deprecated classic drivers

They are pending removal in the Rocky release, at which point we
may get broken. This change removed the enabled_drivers option,
as well as any processing of the classic drivers.

A seemingly unrelated issue was fixed in the fencing unit tests
that prevented the tests from passing.

Change-Id: If1bfe58d416110cdf03201aea015ce53267af2d6
Depends-On: Iae5088e0d8a8a594c9b3a2d625a0daf829ba7b4b

commit_message:
Move run command to utils

The run command in the deploy can be reused. It would be better in utils
rather than buried in the tripleo deploy command.

Change-Id: Ia40660c4d2cfbc8a5c7ff3a2a21e82abd8e3ecd3

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.

Change-Id: I400d4acf93ab634683cd9c4b05db7c79a51810be

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I400d4acf93ab634683cd9c4b05db7c79a51810be

The os_masakari role is necessary for some deployers, so we
want to include this new role to get new contributions. This will
be as a separate deliverable as the main openstack-ansible project,
like others extra roles before it.

Depends-On: I8e2d90d36ff726f29cee99dd2b975bfeeaf4b8f4
Change-Id: I1ee01895903cd17374801356e244738624f9af4a

commit_message:
Add os_masakari to OpenStack-Ansible

The os_masakari role is necessary for some deployers, so we
want to include this new role to get new contributions. This will
be as a separate deliverable as the main openstack-ansible project,
like others extra roles before it.

Depends-On: I8e2d90d36ff726f29cee99dd2b975bfeeaf4b8f4
Change-Id: I1ee01895903cd17374801356e244738624f9af4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 14:40:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add "Edit Port Security Groups" action

This commit adds a new action "Edit Port Security Groups"
which jumps the interfaces tab of the instance detail page.

In addition, a warning message is added to the "Edit Security Groups"
form because if a user change security groups as an instance level
the change will be applied to all interfaces of the instance, so
it would be nice if we can provide a good navigation to a page
of editting security groups per port.

Previously, UpdateMembersStep does not support help_text_template option.
To use a bold tag in the added help message, we need to use a template
instead of help_text, so _workflow_step_update_members.html is updated.

Closes-Bug: #1750147
Change-Id: I71437a376b94cab90df0e423aa7e1d2d0d8387ee

commit_message:
Add "Edit Port Security Groups" action

This commit adds a new action "Edit Port Security Groups"
which jumps the interfaces tab of the instance detail page.

In addition, a warning message is added to the "Edit Security Groups"
form because if a user change security groups as an instance level
the change will be applied to all interfaces of the instance, so
it would be nice if we can provide a good navigation to a page
of editting security groups per port.

Previously, UpdateMembersStep does not support help_text_template option.
To use a bold tag in the added help message, we need to use a template
instead of help_text, so _workflow_step_update_members.html is updated.

Closes-Bug: #1750147
Change-Id: I71437a376b94cab90df0e423aa7e1d2d0d8387ee

commit_message:
Add openstack-dns (Designate) to Chef OpenStack

The openstack-dns is necessary for some deployers. We want to include
this cookbook to foster contribution. This will be a deliverable treated
as other maintained cookbooks in Chef OpenStack.

Depends-On: I499c2a8fdf0d82bc80a8d7ac6aa61d24328930c9
Change-Id: I7c9dee068b1685ae5ea05664be18ca9fb5835704

commit_message:
Unite default parameter_resource name

We need to use same parameter_resource name across the roles
otherwise ansible will fail when --limit option is used.

Change-Id: I4df2328d9a1e1919cfefaefc222f1d43165e588d
Resolves: rhbz#1565374, rhbz#1565395
Related-Bug: #1755078

subject: Remove non-resource-class mentions from configure compute docs
messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.openstack.org/#/c/565736/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 14:32:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove non-resource-class mentions from configure compute docs

Per I22234aafdd195dd76c621b93042a67cdb36f3e65 in Pike, resource
classes are the way to go with scheduling baremetal instances
in the compute service, and nova is actively working on removing
the deprecated baremetal-related scheduling config options like
the Exact* filters, the baremetal_enabled_filters,
use_baremetal_filters, IronicHostManager, etc. So this change
drops the "if you're not using resource classes yet" wording
from the configure compute docs since we don't want people using
the old configuration.

Change-Id: Ide340da0bd8bbfd06f72f32ec7d8977e2949b16e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove non-resource-class mentions from configure compute docs

Per I22234aafdd195dd76c621b93042a67cdb36f3e65 in Pike, resource
classes are the way to go with scheduling baremetal instances
in the compute service, and nova is actively working on removing
the deprecated baremetal-related scheduling config options like
the Exact* filters, the baremetal_enabled_filters,
use_baremetal_filters, IronicHostManager, etc. So this change
drops the "if you're not using resource classes yet" wording
from the configure compute docs since we don't want people using
the old configuration.

Change-Id: Ide340da0bd8bbfd06f72f32ec7d8977e2949b16e

commit_message:
Import os_masakari to openstack-ansible

This patch adds the openstack-ansible-os_masakari role.

An individual core group is added, but the general OSA core group
would have core capabilities as a back-stop.

Needed-By: I1ee01895903cd17374801356e244738624f9af4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-17 12:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for service type aliases

The Service Types Authority defines a list of official service types and
a set of historical aliases. os-service-types encapsulates the
information, which allows us to add support to the catalog discovery for
looking up services by their aliases or their official types.

Depends-On: I57641c9e3c27688b6d7709b1bb07292740d26659
Change-Id: Iae15064e4ecf1ca3144b962815d4ede610a74ff4
'}, {'created': '2017-07-17 20:03:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for service type aliases

The Service Types Authority defines a list of official service types and
a set of historical aliases. os-service-types encapsulates the
information, which allows us to add support to the catalog discovery for
looking up services by their aliases or their official types.

While adding support for aliases, add support for legacy microversion
headers which are driven from the same data. It is not possible to know
whethera service should get old or new microversion headers, but the
services properly ignore the old version if they support the new
version, and prefer the new version if they support it.

Depends-On: I2231c32078533b2ea2a348e67f5c72e5cff5e6b5
Change-Id: Iae15064e4ecf1ca3144b962815d4ede610a74ff4

commit_message:
Add support for service type aliases

The Service Types Authority defines a list of official service types and
a set of historical aliases. os-service-types encapsulates the
information, which allows us to add support to the catalog discovery for
looking up services by their aliases or their official types.

While adding support for aliases, add support for legacy microversion
headers which are driven from the same data. It is not possible to know
whethera service should get old or new microversion headers, but the
services properly ignore the old version if they support the new
version, and prefer the new version if they support it.

Depends-On: I2231c32078533b2ea2a348e67f5c72e5cff5e6b5
Change-Id: Iae15064e4ecf1ca3144b962815d4ede610a74ff4

commit_message:
Add documentation and tooling for legacy environments

A deployer may want to run these tools within a legacy environment
(running Ansible <2.4) but will find it the deployment of these
playbooks impossible to due to the use of new-ish task syntax,
roles, and modules. This change gives deployers options when running
within legacy environments by providing everything needed to deploy
these playbooks using embeded ansible.

Change-Id: Ic99b93017129321b2eb8b773a77f7fa478cc8dc7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
shim _setUpExtension in prep to changing args

The _setUpExtension method of the class
neutron.tests.unit.extensions.base.ExtensionTestCase doesn't use the
resource_attribute_map parameter and thus it should be removed. Rather
than queuing up a bunch of consumers that depend on this function
and trying to merge them together to not break anyone, this patch
proposes that we shim the _setUpExtension by adding setup_extension
without the unused argument. Until consumers move over to the new
method, they can continue to use _setUpExtension which just calls
setup_extension without the attribute map.

Change-Id: Ia59fc1978228f9982d3ee447ebcfcb712eebbdb7

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu

commit_message:
Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu
16.04 on a single node.

Depends-On: I49ca3906df78c3cfbad4012bcdf777f701c69382
Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: Idf6e1f65ddb07e85ce864477aead976fd9a6af27
Depends-On: I06e08a7d0788606143cb9d5a500ca6bb36c907a0
Depends-On: Id717406bdb34bec20c57ae9ae0e50607738fb91d
Change-Id: I95525e63c073eb4fc8f3b1092d371af5a6e008cb
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

commit_message:
Alter default http boot path for containerized Ironic

Containerization is a default choice from now on.
Alter the --http-boot path defaults from /httpboot to
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot as it is configured via puppet
and t-h-t.

For containerized undercloud, /var/lib/ironic/httpboot
creation is already handled via t-h-t host prep tasks.
For legacy instack installations, the dependency patch
overrides hiera defaults as well.

Depends-on: I48e6439f294165a90c622ae55185c8ebb9e79238
Change-Id: Ibafafddce3f9e80348d32d798c54efc610892bc4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace guts with openstack.config

The code has been moved into openstacksdk. Make os-client-config a
thin wrapper around that code.

The legacy client code needs to stay, as it was removed in openstacksdk.

We also have to plumb os_client_config.defaults and
os_client_config.cloud_region.CloudRegion in so that users get the
os-client-config versions from the openstacksdk methods that return the
relevant objects.

Support for per-service region_name has been dropped. This was never
used anywhere and was added for compatibility with openstacksdk Profile
objects. Since Profile objects are no more, we can remove it. It never
made any sense.

Change-Id: I7180e20aa675c0ccbe3718493a6eff2be7e1b8b6

[{'created': '2017-10-10 22:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d
'}]
commit_message:
Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d

'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I391c779e4692d5de526dfda035843b8f5e267a75

commit_message:
Add /var/log/opendaylight directory to ODL

Adding a missing directory to enable the creation of
/var/log/opendaylight/readme.txt file

Change-Id: Id8128ad123b07f5e78eefef407606efedab12aa7

commit_message:
WinSMB volume driver doc: Add Volume backup support

This update is based on the Windows SMB: Volume Backup support
blueprint and merged change 528352 authored and committed by
Lucian Petrut: Change ID: I8769a135974240fdf7cebd4b6d74aaa439ba1f27

Change-Id: If5eea46db6049afc585784277b9f232c26e6da34

[{'created': '2018-04-16 13:50:11.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - Attaches/detaches after host assisted retype failing

There is an issue after host-assisted retype where subsequent actions
on a retyped volume fail due to a volume ID mismatch. This patch
rectifies the issue by checking if the '_name_id' attribute of the
volume matches the volume identifier on the backend, should the volume
'id' attribute comparison fail.

Change-Id: I8badcbd99e25336b1a905b82959e6c3a7bfcc420
Closes-bug: 1763555
"}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Attaches/detaches after host assisted retype failing

There is an issue after host-assisted retype where subsequent actions
on a retyped volume fail due to a volume ID mismatch. This patch
rectifies the issue by checking if the '_name_id' attribute of the
volume matches the volume identifier on the backend, should the volume
'id' attribute comparison fail.

Change-Id: I8badcbd99e25336b1a905b82959e6c3a7bfcc420
Closes-bug: 1763555

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486734 moved try-except
statement to the wrong place. We need to open image in Ceph inside
try-except block.

This patch also fixes race condition between volume deletion and
_get_usage_info calls.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closed-Bug: #1765845

 Conflicts:

in Pike does not take the client and ioctx kwargs when constructed.

(cherry picked from commit 3cc8cbdee7c98e1fcf41bb27d81e34fef3a2d032)
(cherry picked from commit c935eb8305f21745480abb49e1e380f1c9053d9a)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Handle ImageNotFound exception in _get_usage_info correctly

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486734 moved try-except
statement to the wrong place. We need to open image in Ceph inside
try-except block.

This patch also fixes race condition between volume deletion and
_get_usage_info calls.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closed-Bug: #1765845

 Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts were from the fact that the RBDVolumeProxy
in Pike does not take the client and ioctx kwargs when constructed.

Change-Id: I7d3d006b023ca4b7963c4c684e4c036399d1295c

[{'created': '2018-05-01 20:08:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test for netenv validate

Previously we were actually attempting to open a file in the
NIC_validate function when executed by this test because it was not
properly mocked. If you had an empty file /tmp/foo, the test would fail

Change-Id: Iab778b756637ae3e3a4beeea66bfa41b3cedd7b8
Closes-Bug: #1768337
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test for netenv validate

Previously we were actually attempting to open a file in the
NIC_validate function when executed by this test because it was not
properly mocked. If you had an empty file /tmp/foo, the test would fail
because it would try and read data from it.

Change-Id: Iab778b756637ae3e3a4beeea66bfa41b3cedd7b8
Closes-Bug: #1768337

commit_message:
Remove deprecated DEFAULT options

Cinder, nova, neutron has deprecated some default options
since last release, so it is time to remove those options
in this version. refer to the following deprecation patch.

Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290511/

Closes-bug: #1766384

Change-Id: I595ff2c82ef40566145fedb202e549be69c45e0c

commit_message:
[WIP] PDF support on doc

- Modifies conf.py to support PDF builds
  for project-specific docs and releasenotes
- Adds "latex" builder on setup.cfg
  (usage: $ python setup.cfg build_sphinx)
- Adds PDF build commands for "tox -e docs"
  and "tox -e releasenotes"
- Adds binary dependency which are required
  to build a PDF file

Note that editing setup.cfg just generates a tex file
on doc/build/latex folder. The output file name is
Horizon.tex, and Horizon.pdf file is generated by calling
make command on the folder.

Change-Id: Ia6a5c3cf19625a0c14a45b21f8c03f2f70574d60

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Get correct compute usage when "project_id" specified

When try to update quota of a tenant, it may fail with message
"Quota value(s) cannot be less than the current usage value(s): xxx",
even if this tenant is empty.
This is because tenant filter not work when calling "server list" API
without "all_tenants=True". See nova bug below:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1185290
This patch will help tenant filter work and get correct compute usage.

Change-Id: Idca73a67c87f925ae601d06c9b9e8f7435ef40d1
Closes-Bug: #1708085

subject: Adds Doc Pages
messages:
[{'account_id': 23382, 'date': '2017-08-09 11:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2017-08-09 11:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

It's quite hard for me to tell what this is about, but here's a few points;

- It needs a linked blueprint, which it doesn't have, since the "implements" message is malformed. Should be "implements: blueprint <blueprint-name>"
- We're currently in Feature Freeze, so this is blocked for now.
- This appears to be adding several new libraries. We don't commit libraries to Horizons source. They need to be packaged as xstatic packages, but first we need to decide if we want to introduce this many new dependencies
- Why not just add the docs to the existing documentation and link to that? Adding a whole second documentation infrastructure seems unnecessary.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-08-09 12:09:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with Rob's feedbacks.

Similar to Rob's 4th point, I wonder how we can maintain this in a sustainable way. It is worth discussed. We don't want to have two separate documents which are mostly duplicated from various maintenance POV."}, {'account_id': 23382, 'date': '2017-08-09 12:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-09 15:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Adds Doc Pages

This commit adds the ability to create/delete 'doc' pages of which may
contain tutorials on how to use the dashboard.  The doc pages bind
to URL of pages of dashboard via a link.

Change-Id: Ieaaac39ca876724d0604c64d3795b8359a1f688c
Implements: blueprint doc-pages

(1 comment)

I'm not sure how this interacts with the browser history and the back button, etc. I need to test it more. For now, can you please fix the commit message?"}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2017-06-29 13:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This doesn't make sense as a POST. It's a GET. https://www.w3.org/2001/tag/doc/whenToUseGet.html#checklist

If there's missing validation, then that needs to be improved.

To see more about the commit messages as mentioned by Radomir, please read https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Summary_of_Git_commit_message_structure"}, {'account_id': 26304, 'date': '2017-06-29 13:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2017-06-30 02:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think there should show the value entered earlier after click the submit button.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-07-10 11:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree that changing the method is not the right approach.

I also think specifying start and end is a valid use case as long as valid values are specified so we should keep the current behavior.

On the other hand, I see some point to be improved.
If an invalid value is specified, the form should have a value which is actually used, i.e., the message says that today is as a fallback, so such values should be populated as the form values.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-27 07:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:

Closes-Bug: #1695802

commit_message:
report when loading data from the cache file

Add debug output to show when we are loading data from the cache file
instead of scanning the git history, to make debugging easier.

Change-Id: I42e96679b8c9e0369a6bc463a7fc99f78d6d55f9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
