subject: tests: Update URL for ansible-role-systemd_service
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-02 09:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-02 09:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-02 10:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 09:16:43.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Update URL for ansible-role-systemd_service

This fixes the following problem

failed: [localhost] (item={'name': u'systemd_service', 'src':
u'https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service', 'scm':
u'git', 'version': u'master'}) => {"changed": false, "failed": true,
"item": {"name": "systemd_service", "scm": "git", "src":
"https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service", "version":
"master"}, "msg": "Failed to set a new url
https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service for origin:
fatal: No such remote 'origin'\n"}

This happens because zuul automatically clones dependant projects using
the git.openstack.org URLs but here we used the github.com one and that
led to module failures.

Change-Id: Id9b0f45af9f9393cd63e6f60b37e55cf16d08631
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Update URL for ansible-role-systemd_service

This fixes the following problem

failed: [localhost] (item={'name': u'systemd_service', 'src':
u'https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service', 'scm':
u'git', 'version': u'master'}) => {"changed": false, "failed": true,
"item": {"name": "systemd_service", "scm": "git", "src":
"https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service", "version":
"master"}, "msg": "Failed to set a new url
https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service for origin:
fatal: No such remote 'origin'\n"}

This happens because zuul automatically clones dependant projects using
the git.openstack.org URLs but here we used the github.com one and that
led to module failures.

Change-Id: Id9b0f45af9f9393cd63e6f60b37e55cf16d08631

commit_message:
Read ha_state file only once

check_ha_state_for_router() can potentially read the
ha_state file three times, since ha_state is a defined
as a property in the HaRouter() class.  Read ha_state
into a local variable and use it instead.

Change-Id: Icabe0baf961abe4ddd0699716f26dc96696eb8b1

commit_message:
Remove [placement]/os_region_name usage

The [placement]/os_region_name config option is deprecated
and no longer required to be set (the default is fine for
devstack) with the dependent nova change.

Depends-On: I973180d6a384b32838ab61d4e6aaf73c255fd116

Change-Id: I6379acf179ed511f1cdadbd7fb09e2454182a5d3

[{'created': '2017-08-02 18:57:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add catch-all for property errors in implicit dependencies

commit_message:
Add catch-all for property errors in implicit dependencies

The previous patch ensures that we ignore errors getting properties in
all extant add_dependencies() methods for calculating implicit
dependencies. To guard against similar errors in future, also ignore and
log any uncaught ValueError or TypeError exceptions encountered during
implicit dependency calculation.

Change-Id: I2cac0add975e36a9c52b9cbb50f0660882322754
Related-Bug: #1708209

Puppet-openstack attempst to install puppet using:

"python setup.py isntall"

Though in Debian, setuptools isn't even installed for Python 2, so it
fails. As the comment in run_tests.sh mentioned the use of setuptools

commit_message:
Debian: using packages for installing Tempest

Puppet-openstack attempst to install puppet using:

"python setup.py isntall"

Though in Debian, setuptools isn't even installed for Python 2, so it
fails. As the comment in run_tests.sh mentioned the use of setuptools
and pip is temporary, this patch switches to the packaged version of
tempest, testr and os-testr, using apt-get install instead of pip.

Change-Id: I6a2a04dd0e0f2d7d89da538a53af420d52dcfd20

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-28 02:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Get rid of a extra copy of workflow environment

* Previously, we had two copies of the workflow environment
  passed by a user: one was in the 'params' fields under ke 'env'
  key and another one was copied into the 'context' field under
  the '__env' key so that we can evaluate expressions involving
  the env() function (YAQL or Jinja).
  This patch removes the copy from the 'context' field in favor
  of using an ad-hoc ContextView structure where we now also
  weave in the environment dictionary under the same key '__env'.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I1204b082794b376787d126136a79dd204ec3af07
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of a extra copy of workflow environment

* Previously, we had two copies of the workflow environment
  passed by a user: one was in the 'params' fields under ke 'env'
  key and another one was copied into the 'context' field under
  the '__env' key so that we can evaluate expressions involving
  the env() function (YAQL or Jinja).
  This patch removes the copy from the 'context' field in favor
  of using an ad-hoc ContextView structure where we now also
  weave in the environment dictionary under the same key '__env'.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I1204b082794b376787d126136a79dd204ec3af07

commit_message:
Do not copy workflow environment into subworkflows

* We previously always copied a workflow environment of a parent
  workflow into a subworkflow when starting it. However, this is
  redundant because we now have 'root_execution_id' field in the
  the workflow execution model so that we can always get an
  environment of a subworkflow just by accessing the root execution.
  It saves a lot of space in DB and increases performance in cases
  when we have a large workflow environment and many subworkflows.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I15077240ba53663a6267b886ab7b081a7dde2710

threads placement to take into account the possibility to pin emulator
threads on CON.cpu_shared_set.

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: Ie3437d26fd6dfa884c86e18d69c1b1398d821dbe
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3d1ee579cb1af0272cae6c55b5cc455e3e1e6a37)

commit_message:
Add sudo into instack's semanage call.

When having a file with incorrect SELinux context
in /home/stac/.ssh a permission error is displayed
at the time of running semanage during Pike to
Queens undercloud upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1767405
Change-Id: I994917e491d6f8b4141a3c332c79ed8e8ce8e64c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 11:16:28.000000000', 'message': 'Make host param for nova/neutron/ceilometer immutable during upgrade

We set the host value of those three services to whatever is returned
by $fdqn.  Unfortunately this can change because of system change on
the host.  Worse, in Mitaka to Newton upgrade we explicitly change its
value (from not set to $fqdn).

The main impact for neutron are l3-agents.  They are set in an HA
configuration, so the new agents are not taking over the previous
workload.  The impact is a complete lost of FIP connectivity.

For nova, we lose the ability to manipulate vm after the upgrade.

Depends-On: I6ada9c603f123039395f05e7a3e0cc0087023e43

Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1763322

Change-Id: I8f075a5ad869ef0dc72a700dcb7be0b6efca787a
'}]
commit_message:
Make host param for nova/neutron/ceilometer immutable during upgrade

We set the host value of those three services to whatever is returned
by $fdqn.  Unfortunately this can change because of system change on
the host.  Worse, in Mitaka to Newton upgrade we explicitly change its
value (from not set to $fqdn).

The main impact for neutron are l3-agents.  They are set in an HA
configuration, so the new agents are not taking over the previous
workload.  The impact is a complete lost of FIP connectivity.

For nova, we lose the ability to manipulate vm after the upgrade.

Depends-On: I6ada9c603f123039395f05e7a3e0cc0087023e43

Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1763322

Change-Id: I8f075a5ad869ef0dc72a700dcb7be0b6efca787a

commit_message:
Add os-net-config into requirements

As we moved most of the undercloud.py logic into tripleoclient,
add that os-net-config dependency into requirement.txt as well.

There is also related rpm dependency proposed to be
copied from instack-undercloud RPM to the client package
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/13594/

Change-Id: Iacecb0cd121a47179b9290c3c7726138e59cd2f8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update swift_devices_mount_point propagation settings

The mount is "rprivate" by default, change this to "shared"
such that mount points will dynamically propagate.

Closes-Bug: #1767828

Change-Id: If3b99bd1626a44aa7b41cf7d50d67b4fc9634462

commit_message:
Exposes HAProxy socket on the host

This will allow to interact with HAProxy directly from the host, in
order to either get stats or send commands.

Change-Id: Ia8f2767cf2d277c6d48dd4b423cf89e5f211acc4
Closes-Bug: 1768189

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-28 18:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Make `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive for real

When we introduced `cpu_model_extra_flags` config attribute (in
commit: 6b601b7 -- "libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature
flags"), we told it was case-insensitive; but unfortunately I missed to
_really_ make it so (despite proposing code for it in one of the
revisions).

Address that mistake by making `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive
for real, from Nova's point of view.

NB: Internally, this patch is normalizing 'extra_flags' to _lower_
casing -- because CPU flags _must_ be lower case from libvirt's point of
view.  Nova must honour that; otherwise, launching instances with an
upper case CPU flag, 'FOO', will fail with: "libvirtError: internal
error: Unknown CPU feature FOO".

Change-Id: Ia7ff0566a5109c76c009f3a0c6199c4ba419cfb1
Reported-by: Daniel P. Berrang√© <berrange@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags

commit_message:
libvirt: Make `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive for real

When we introduced `cpu_model_extra_flags` config attribute (in
commit: 6b601b7 -- "libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature
flags"), we said it was case-insensitive; but unfortunately I missed to
_really_ make it so (despite proposing code for it in one of the
revisions).

Address that mistake by making `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive
for real, from Nova's point of view.

NB: Internally, this patch is normalizing 'extra_flags' to _lower_
casing -- because CPU flags _must_ be lower case from libvirt's point of
view.  Nova must honour that; otherwise, launching instances with an
upper case CPU flag, 'FOO', will fail with: "libvirtError: internal
error: Unknown CPU feature FOO".

Related-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: Ia7ff0566a5109c76c009f3a0c6199c4ba419cfb1
Reported-by: Daniel P. Berrang√© <berrange@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq-env.conf ownership in bifrost

The permissions of rabbitmq-env.conf for bifrost were changed in
I6e32d94d4172dd96d09d8609e8a5221ab5586a31 to 0660. This breaks bifrost

root-owned file on startup.

Change-Id: I53418f5d4e40b7ca57e546e2e92a57f613fd381e

I6e32d94d4172dd96d09d8609e8a5221ab5586a31 to 0660. This breaks bifrost
deployment, as the rabbitmq user is no longer able to read the
root-owned file on startup.

This commit changes the ownership of the file in the container to

Change-Id: I53418f5d4e40b7ca57e546e2e92a57f613fd381e
Closes-Bug: #1766196

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq-env.conf ownership in bifrost

The permissions of rabbitmq-env.conf for bifrost were changed in
I6e32d94d4172dd96d09d8609e8a5221ab5586a31 to 0660. This breaks bifrost
deployment, as the rabbitmq user is no longer able to read the
root-owned file on startup.

This commit changes the ownership of the file in the container to
rabbitmq:rabbitmq after it has been copied.

Change-Id: I53418f5d4e40b7ca57e546e2e92a57f613fd381e
Closes-Bug: #1766196

commit_message:
fix list-deliverables for the independent series

An earlier commit tried to make the canonical form of the independent
series name just 'independent', but it did not update the
list-deliverables command. This patch completes the work.

Change-Id: Ie161325f58f762d417031b2b70b57c49d72a2f9f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add --force alias for --no-shortcut option to list-changes

I can never remember what the option --no-shortcut is called, so add
aliases --force and -f which are the more common name for this sort of
option.

Change-Id: I466a04e58c84c07d2f43352913e540b8e6d3bbf2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-27 21:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-02 06:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 21:31:03.000000000', 'message': "ignore the reno cache when building the set of release notes

For list-changes and the announcement emails we want to ignore any
local cache file created when a package was built and scan the git
repository again. The cache file is meant to be used by the consumer
of the package being released, but we have the git repository so we
don't need it and ignoring it will ensure we have the correct notes in
any announcements.

Change-Id: I047f7e455a1d238d12cf94a60cd0d44f44406a3d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore the reno cache when building the set of release notes

For list-changes and the announcement emails we want to ignore any
local cache file created when a package was built and scan the git
repository again. The cache file is meant to be used by the consumer
of the package being released, but we have the git repository so we
don't need it and ignoring it will ensure we have the correct notes in
any announcements.

Change-Id: I047f7e455a1d238d12cf94a60cd0d44f44406a3d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
stop if announce.sh fails to build the virtualenv

If the announce script cannot set up the tools it needs it should not
continue.

Change-Id: If66a5f863976c5c2010ac7d5c2efdfed55ff58c1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure tasks aren't empty dicts

Ansible doesn't like it when tasks are empty dicts so let's make sure
we aren't passing an empty dict in to the ansible tasks. Unfortunately
since we're validating non-heat processed yaml, the list_concats end
up being dicts to the yaml validator so we can't just ensure they are
always lists.

Change-Id: I13dcc4f3d4ea2ac4c7ab62887dfea293246f6530
Related-Bug: #1768019

commit_message:
Added featureset052 for installing containerized UC

* It only install cont UC and does not tests undercloud_check_idempotency
* It will be used upstream to gate mistral, heat, Ironic and other
  projects.
* Added condition to detect heat upstream project

Change-Id: Iaf6a9dc5f64d33d967ae0cb433642bd75812b6db

commit_message:
Ceph: allow un-interupted operation during partial mon outage

This PS updates the ceph chart to allow un-interupted operation
during partial mon outage.

commit_message:
Edit reproducer for libvirt-volume-path and renamed playbook

 - Adds the option to define a custome libvirt-volume-path.
 - Calls renamed libvirt-nodepool playbook

Depends-On: I8f8bd3dde63ab8d8d449a418d008a0e796ed3202

commit_message:
Move tests to tripleo deploy

After refactoring the deployment command, the tests should be migrated
to the tripleo deploy command tests. Additionally some of the utility
functions have been moved to tripleoclient.utils.

Change-Id: I48b77a4c91412a0fba9a78bc5fe5f81d8962ac18
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-04-30 14:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Thanks for the patch, sorry, I didn't have time to review, and am just looking quickly.  For all of our other X-WAIT states, they transition to X-ING (some very briefly in this state) before transitioning to the target state. Wondering if it makes sense to do so with INSPECTWAIT too (you know, 'consistency')

Just had a quick irc discussion [1] with Dmitry about it. We're good either way.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-04-30.log.html#t2018-04-30T14:03:14"}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-05-02 03:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Thanks for the patch, sorry, I didn't have time to review, and am
 > just looking quickly.  For all of our other X-WAIT states, they
 > transition to X-ING (some very briefly in this state) before
 > transitioning to the target state. Wondering if it makes sense to
 > do so with INSPECTWAIT too (you know, 'consistency')
 > 
 > Just had a quick irc discussion [1] with Dmitry about it. We're
 > good either way.
 > 
 > [1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2018-04-30.log.html#t2018-04-30T14:03:14

Thank you rloo for the info, are you proposing we transition from inspect wait to manageable by two consecutive events, or doing more changes to comply with other x-wait states?

Currently we still do the inspection work at inspect wait state instead of inspecting state, to be fully consistent with other x-wait states, I think we need to change the logic as follows:

1. ironic received inspect request and moves node to "inspecting" state.
2. according to return value of inspector driver, node is moved to "manageable" for MANAGEABLE, or "inspect wait" for INSPECTWAIT.
3. in the status checking periodic task, if a node is in some state (starting or processing? we can verify that later), the node is moved to "inspecting" state, and after the inspection is done, we move the node to "manageable" or "inspect failed" state according to inspection result (finished / error states)

The change is incompatible with current implementation as we disallow node update in the "inspecting" state after api version 1.39.
If you think it worth the efforts, we can file a story for tracking, wdyt?'}]

commit_message:
Implementation of inspect wait state

This patch provides implementations to feature of adding inspect wait state.

Changes covered in this patch:

* Added state and transitions, state diagram regenerated.
* inspector and oneview inspect interface now return INSPECTWAIT instead of
  INSPECTING. Move node to inspect wait if inspect interface returns
  INSPECTING or INSPECTWAIT.
* Add a timeout option to conductor, and a periodic task to check timeout
  in the inspect wait state.

Story: #1725211
Task: #10630

Partial-Bug: #1725211
Change-Id: Ie76bfdad5966014a4dae826919ff5705462c743b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 05:38:28.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]Enhance zun update command

Right now, for renaming the container we need to use zun rename
but we can  move this  into PATCH /containers/<container>
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L570)
because this is the convention of API design in OpenStack
(e.g. nova implements server rename at PUT /servers/<server>).

This PS adds support for rename container using update command
as well:
    zun update [--cpu <cpu>] [-m <memory>] [--name <name>] <container>

Change-Id: I237a849dec549f53efe560a04fc0ca64929c14e7
Related-Bug: #1759459

commit_message:
Enhance zun update command

Right now, for renaming the container we need to use zun rename
but we can  move this  into PATCH /containers/<container>
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L570)
because this is the convention of API design in OpenStack
(e.g. nova implements server rename at PUT /servers/<server>).

This PS adds support for rename container using update command
as well:
    zun update [--cpu <cpu>] [-m <memory>] [--name <name>] <container>

Change-Id: I237a849dec549f53efe560a04fc0ca64929c14e7
Related-Bug: #1759459

commit_message:
Add user_id to RequestSpec

The user_id field was not implemented in RequestSpec like project_id was.
Some people have out of tree filters which use the user_id field.

This change makes the user_id field available.

Closes-bug: #1768107
Change-Id: I3e174ae76931f8279540e92328c7c36a7bcaabc0

commit_message:
Update auth_url value in install docs

Follow the keystone install guide by using port 5000
as the default auth_url, this change is to update manila
install guide to follow that.

Change-Id: I1dadd202742a88d80978065f0501b668e859793c
Closes-bug: #1754104

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 20:09:21.000000000', 'message': "Rename get-undercloud-ip.sh --> get-domain-ip.sh

Context: https://trello.com/c/qgIz0V08

This commit simply renames the get-undercloud-ip.sh
script to be more generically named, as in the
libvirt-nodepool reproducer (where it's used) it is
not limited to UC.

Note: not touching the libvirt/setup/undercloud
role's version of this script (which is the same) is
intentional, ans is to mitigate risk.

The tripleo-ci team has backlog work to make obtaining
the IP(s) of running domains a generic role (which would
support additional networking topologies).  Modifying
parts of TQ not utilized by libvirt nodepool reproducer
is out of scope for this commit.

Change-Id: I51040db2e85296229ff98e5c691c39af8d276c0a

commit_message:
Rename get-undercloud-ip.sh --> get-domain-ip.sh

Context: https://trello.com/c/qgIz0V08

This commit simply renames the get-undercloud-ip.sh
script to be more generically named, as in the
libvirt-nodepool reproducer (where it's used) it is
not limited to UC.

Note: not touching the libvirt/setup/undercloud
role's version of this script (which is the same) is
intentional, and is intended to mitigate risk.

Modifying parts of TQ not utilized by libvirt nodepool
reproducer is out of scope for this commit.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565280
Change-Id: I51040db2e85296229ff98e5c691c39af8d276c0a

commit_message:
Use versioned object instead of db_api

In websocket proxy module, it directly used db_api to retrieve the
container. It is better to use versioned object instead since
versioned object has several benenfits, such as support upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic8697f4a3fe3ed522fea802225061004203952ad
Closes-Bug: #1766132

commit_message:
Fix issues with missing service

When Adjutant has sizes defined for a service
that isn't in all regions, we need to skip that
service when doing size comparisons if the current
usage doesn't contain that service.

Change-Id: Iea6a03d97e03501fff6e0635d079759faafbd18b
(cherry picked from commit fbe6067bdcae78085388ab4f42d2a809a4af909e)

commit_message:
Fix issues with missing service

When Adjutant has sizes defined for a service
that isn't in all regions, we need to skip that
service when doing size comparisons if the current
usage doesn't contain that service.

Change-Id: Iea6a03d97e03501fff6e0635d079759faafbd18b

subject: Deployments: set max_unavailible to 0
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 21:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Deployments: set max_unavailible to 0

This PS sets the maximum unavailible pods to 0 for deployments,
this allows hitless upgrades of single instance deployments, and
allow allow use of helms own wait functionaility for dev use.

Change-Id: I3b63814aab8f670d41d984dbf7709b50be023b51
'}]
commit_message:
Deployments: set max_unavailible to 0

This PS sets the maximum unavailible pods to 0 for deployments,
this allows hitless upgrades of single instance deployments, and
allow allow use of helms own wait functionaility for dev use.

Change-Id: I3b63814aab8f670d41d984dbf7709b50be023b51

subject: Gate: Temp fix for zuul runner
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 19:40:19.000000000', 'message': 'Gate: Temp fix for zuul runner

commit_message:
Misc improvements to libvirt nodepool reproducer

Context: https://trello.com/c/qgIz0V08

This commit iterates on the initial commit of the
libvirt reproducer here:

- https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/f37173b02444c7b056078967bf797c6cad45a7e8

In this commit:

- remove "fake" from variable and file names.
- remove extra spacing on templates.
- Previously, we had used the supersede option which replaced the
  internal DNS server with the external one. Testers on different
  systems requires more DNS server options and this review uses the
  append option to achieve that.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564865
Change-Id: I8f8bd3dde63ab8d8d449a418d008a0e796ed3202

commit_message:
Rename test_regex to test_white_regex

* https://review.openstack.org/551441 introduced test_black_regex
  in order to skip test directly from featureset files. In order
  to avoid confusion between test_regex and test_black_regex, we
  are renaming test_regex to test_white_regex.
 * It will fix all the featuresets.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560006
Change-Id: If66225c2e2f8c571cc85aebacee01431e4f64dcc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 01:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix key error with unknown service in size

When Adjutant has sizes defined for a service that
only exists in certain regions, this can cause errors.

If we come across a region without that service, skip
the service.

Change-Id: Icc6b8cc3aaed408c10dc4fb54c54fe2376cf2a88
'}]
commit_message:
Fix key error with unknown service in size

When Adjutant has sizes defined for a service that
only exists in certain regions, this can cause errors.

If we come across a region without that service, skip
the service.

Change-Id: Icc6b8cc3aaed408c10dc4fb54c54fe2376cf2a88

commit_message:
Register versioned endpoint for block-storage service

cinder does not yet support operations without project_id in the url.
The unversioned endpoint is not a usable endpoint for a user that
requests the block-storage service. Although it would be lovely to have
the block-storage service have the unversioned endpoint in the catalog,
we need to get project-id out of the urls first.

Change-Id: I4246708b6ea31496ba4d565ab422abc76f730ee7
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/564494

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 12:30:49.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to
specify multiple CPU feature flags:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

(A future patch will also allow ability to remove feature flags.)

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model=Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags="pdpe1gb"

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' or
    AMD 'svm' flags in the level-1 Nova guest.

Closes-Bug: #1766208
Change-Id: I9a862619f379057bb48cb85a84dfc50d763030a6
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 13:19:21.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to
specify multiple CPU feature flags:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

(A future patch will also allow ability to remove feature flags.)

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model = Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags = pdpe1gb

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' or
    AMD 'svm' flags for the level-1 Nova guest CPU models.  (Assuming
    the 'nested' flag is enabled on the level-0 / bare-metal kernel.)

Closes-Bug: #1766208

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but

why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to
specify multiple CPU feature flags:

'}, {'created': '2018-04-27 10:38:07.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to specify
multiple CPU feature flags for all three CPU modes for the libvirt
driver: 'custom', 'host-model', and 'host-passthrough'

For example:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model = Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags = pdpe1gb

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' or
    AMD 'svm' flags for the level-1 Nova guest CPU models.  (Assuming
    the 'nested' flag is enabled on the level-0 / bare-metal kernel.)

(A future Nova patch will also allow ability to remove CPU flags.)

Change-Id: I9a862619f379057bb48cb85a84dfc50d763030a6
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags

commit_message:
libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to specify
multiple CPU feature flags for all three CPU modes for the libvirt
driver: 'custom', 'host-model', and 'host-passthrough'.

For example:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model = Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags = pdpe1gb

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' (or
    AMD 'svm') flags for the level-1 Nova guest CPU models.  (Assuming
    the 'nested' flag is enabled on the level-0 / bare-metal kernel.)

(A future Nova patch will also allow ability to remove CPU flags.)

Change-Id: I9a862619f379057bb48cb85a84dfc50d763030a6
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags

commit_message:
Add Workflow To Create Overcloudrc Files

This patch adds a workflow to generate the overcloudrc files in a
given deployment so the tripleo.deployment.overcloudrc action does
not need to be called directly.

Change-Id: I9da87beb0a3be967bad4b07c2072ccb5e1f3a6cb
Partial-Bug: 1640436

Build images with a 4k block size filesystem

This will support both 512b and 4k disks.

Change-Id: I1e64647b3de86bc87a2a04cedf54ac83bbd4963d
Closes-Bug: #1746727

commit_message:
Update the horizon vhost filename

The puppet-horizon defaults to 15 so it was probably
15 at one stage but we are now setting it to 10 in t-h-t.

Also add executable permissions to the healthcheck file.

Change-Id: I7c13cac950de568237eed1fd4b2a97d85b2aed0d

commit_message:
Fix dynamic inventory

Commit If834e5e60f79a7418cbc1441d2aaf85507ac7bd2 broke support for the
dynamic inventory since Ansible requires different formats for the hosts
value in groups.

This patch corrects the issue and restores the ability to use
tripleo-ansible-inventory as either a static or dynamic inventory
source.

Change-Id: I035bb878508ceab06279cbaf07969aafeb66b9e5
Story: 2001929

subject: Create keypair for SSH access to Octavia amphorae
messages: [{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-05-01 16:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-01 20:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 16:07:20.000000000', 'message': "Create keypair for SSH access to Octavia amphorae

Create keypair from a given public key file under the project name for
Octavia ('service' by default). If a public key file is not provided,
the public key of the undercloud stack user will be used.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560879/
Change-Id: I3b2e283f6fa081b07cc12a244c14701e431d884e
(cherry picked from commit bd710fd838896431b25a24e767e43043ed00062e)

commit_message:
Create keypair for SSH access to Octavia amphorae

Create keypair from a given public key file under the project name for
Octavia ('service' by default). If a public key file is not provided,
the public key of the undercloud stack user will be used.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560879/
Change-Id: I3b2e283f6fa081b07cc12a244c14701e431d884e
(cherry picked from commit bd710fd838896431b25a24e767e43043ed00062e)

subject: Revert "Fixes ceph-external docker service name"
messages:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-04-23 13:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It seems like the name is being modified to suit ceph-ansible.  In the puppet versions we have ceph-external as the name, and it has been changed here in the docker version.  I think the root cause should be addressed in the proper place and not by hacking the name.  Otherwise we have 2 tht services with the same service name.  Or an alternative is change the name of the file to be ceph-external-client.yaml and references like description to indicate it is a client and that it should not be used with oither ceph-client service.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Otherwise we have 2 tht services with the same service name.

is it causing any issue though? we will never have both CephClient and CephExternal enabled at the same time, so in heat any of the two will be ceph_client'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Otherwise we have 2 tht services with the same service name.
 > 
 > is it causing any issue though? we will never have both CephClient
 > and CephExternal enabled at the same time, so in heat any of the
 > two will be ceph_client

Well the only reason I know about this is because a user did put both services on a custom role and it fails :)  The error is not obvious to a user as to what has gone wrong.  Clarity into what the service actually is (ceph-external could mean a lot of things) and/or not duplicating internal naming (unless there is explicit documentation saying do not use this with ceph-client) would prevent this from happening again for other users.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Well the only reason I know about this is because a user did put
 > both services on a custom role and it fails :)

the services can go together on a role, they can't be enabled together, but this is by design

we might think about extending CephClient to deal better with the external Ceph use case and deprecate the CephExternal role but it's a bigger effort and poses some backward compatibility issues

given in the present state of things the code is broken while if we revert the change everything works, I'd merge the revert the change and then work on a more elegant solution"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Revert "Fixes ceph-external docker service name"

This reverts commit b02740533db5bbb05331f127dc22866cc870f15b. The
CephExternal service is managed like CephClient by ceph-ansible,
except for the additional parameter we need to pass to explicitly
list the MONs.

Change-Id: Icb56b4dffb5c5d813239cb5077b1e3a4ae8f21d1
Closes-Bug: #1765788

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 17:12:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes HA Proxy backend check for ODL

This patch removed listen_options for ODL:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562036/

Which introduced a regression where default options were then applied
for ODL, including httpchk.  This does not work with ODL because ODL
will not respond to an HTTP GET without specific paths used.  This patch
adds the correct path that may be used to issue HTTP backend check.

Closes-Bug: 1768037

Change-Id: I60bdfc436044851ac02449c262d382b07b888f79
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c53ea2512f963b1fa461fdedb853f9303dd042b1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes HA Proxy backend check for ODL

This patch removed listen_options for ODL:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562036/

Which introduced a regression where default options were then applied
for ODL, including httpchk.  This does not work with ODL because ODL
will not respond to an HTTP GET without specific paths used.  This patch
adds the correct path that may be used to issue HTTP backend check.

Closes-Bug: 1768037

Change-Id: I60bdfc436044851ac02449c262d382b07b888f79
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c53ea2512f963b1fa461fdedb853f9303dd042b1)

commit_message:
Add in a STOPSIGNAL configuration

For docker 1.13.1, if STOPSIGNAL is not provided in the docker image,
the container will not automatically restart the container.  It might be
better to define this in the Kolla scripts as a configuration option for
each container, but I'm unsure if it's a problem for any other version
so it might be best to configure this in tripleo until a newer version
of docker is consumed. Additionally I'm not sure if any of the
containers would need something other than STOPSIGNAL SIGTERM which
should be the default if none is provided.

Change-Id: I1939f9e6b2c432a672c7426ddabdcfca6ce150b7
Related-Bug: #1765802
(cherry picked from commit 039dbccb5d568953e281a21854916b60ad0a98e4)

commit_message:
Add role to manage snapshots in a libvirt environment

Adds basic snapshotting of a libvirt environment, using
external snapshots with backing files. Limitations of
this approach can be seen in the README.

Change-Id: I7e17ae96202cf8975c0414b884c50e81a218bf7f

commit_message:
Introduce docker_insecure_registries parameter

Introduce docker_insecure_registries that is an array of host/port
combiniations of docker insecure registries. The default value will
be the previous parameter that were hardcoded, but now we can easily
override it in undercloud.conf.

Note: the feature is already supported for the containerized undercloud
but was only missing in instack-undercloud. This patch will be
backported.

Depends-On: I14fda3481ac88429648bed8edb2f4469b33be957
Change-Id: I402ebb80b1d755cdb0c3c28fd542121bc60cb144
Closes-Bug: #1767373
(cherry picked from commit 2ee1ebfd34d72a91311ed7683c272b070fde61ea)

commit_message:
Moving installation of tempest plugins to tempest-rpm file

These packages are only needed when tempest_format is packages,
since the containerized tempest already have all the packages
installed in the docker image, let's save a few seconds here.

Change-Id: Id107ffc2f86ad0771658e77fb9e7c0aa84625005

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 18:59:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use stack_id of None for service timer

In order to keep the engine service alive, we add a timer that periodically
does nothing. Calls to add_timer() require a stack_id, and currently we
pass cfg.CONF.periodic_interval. This is highly misleading, because the
value you pass for the stack_id has no effect on the interval. The cause
was a copy-paste error in 07884448fed64badcf8922c01c1ea044462584b7, when
the code changed from calling ThreadGroup.add_timer() to
ThreadGroupManager.add_timer(). Use None as the stack ID instead.

Change-Id: Ia24a0d3ae9a0295fc811eb5300656399f426408b
'}]
commit_message:
Use stack_id of None for service timer

In order to keep the engine service alive, we add a timer that periodically
does nothing. Calls to add_timer() require a stack_id, and currently we
pass cfg.CONF.periodic_interval. This is highly misleading, because the
value you pass for the stack_id has no effect on the interval. The cause
was a copy-paste error in 07884448fed64badcf8922c01c1ea044462584b7, when
the code changed from calling ThreadGroup.add_timer() to
ThreadGroupManager.add_timer(). Use None as the stack ID instead.

Change-Id: Ia24a0d3ae9a0295fc811eb5300656399f426408b

commit_message:
Set optional API version-related environment vars

If OSC's default values for API versions are not suitable, this change
allows overriding them using environment variables.
This applies to the compute, network, image, volume, identity and object
services.

Change-Id: I5447be16d71a3baa4224dae222d710be9d49b759

subject: Allow tuples and sets in interface list
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-26 13:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-26 16:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-05-01 16:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nNote that sets are unsorted, lists and tuples are. I'm inclined to say we shouldn't do sets, but if we do allow sets, I'd allow any iterable."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-05-01 20:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 13:04:33.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tuples and sets in interface list

While writing an SDK patch, I accidentaly sent a tuple for interface and
things went boom. We already accept a list, so go ahead and accept
tuples and sets too.

commit_message:
Allow tuples and sets in interface list

While writing an SDK patch, I accidentaly sent a tuple for interface and
things went boom. We already accept a list, so go ahead and accept
tuples and sets too.

Change-Id: I4b14792c7eda4e489c53fdc95e40bde14a61c052

Generate undercloud_parameters in output_dir

Help undercloud_parameters.yaml to find way out
of /tmp box.

Move write_env_file into tripleoclient utils for
better unit testing.

[{'created': '2018-05-01 21:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'add --anonymize flag to the summarize command

This flag can help us look at numbers without being distracted by who
is making the contributions, which is useful for understanding if a
single organization is contributing disproportionately relative to
others.

'}]
commit_message:
add --anonymize flag to the summarize command

This flag can help us look at numbers without being distracted by who
is making the contributions, which is useful for understanding if a
single organization is contributing disproportionately relative to
others.

Change-Id: I6fcaf4cc19441f162ec6b9c6f3ee8bd780878a76
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

subject: Use params for REST call against Senlin
messages:
[{'account_id': 25138, 'date': '2018-04-26 23:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-26 23:32:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25138, 'date': '2018-04-26 23:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28159, 'date': '2018-04-27 00:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-04-27 06:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

This will break the API. This should be fixed on Senlin side.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-04-28 01:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Mehdi, this is a cross-project topic, so I'd suggest we do it carefully.
There is no problem for Aodh to send notifications in whatever way the developers like. What I would argue is that the current body format has better get improved. Enumerating all fields in the root level is obviously not a design for future extensions. When team decide to add a field, remove a field, it will be a major change. If we wrap the current set of fields into one root level element, we have the flexibility to add new fields in future. I really hope Aodh API to be "enhanced" from consumer's perspective.
By the way, is the notification API already documented and published somewhere?'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-04-28 05:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Changing the payload format is an API breakage, we can't break it just for one application."}, {'account_id': 25138, 'date': '2018-05-01 21:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use params for REST call against Senlin

The Senlin webhooks API has JSON Schema that expects
a field calls "params". As can be seen here:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/objects/requests/webhooks.py#L30

Change-Id: Ib5e688b5822115ec05ac2631e5758493d1fec05f

commit_message:
Use os.rename, not mv.

There were a few places where we were shelling out to mv instead
of just calling the built in python implementation. Fix those.

Change-Id: I3666a625c4a00dc6df454732756d6091fafbd977

commit_message:
Apparmor profiles for Queens

Apparmor profiles were limiting queens deployments of neutron-gateway
when aa-profile-mode was set to enforce. It led to failed instance
deployments due to neutron agents failing to execute their necessary
functions.

This change updates the profiles to be Queens ready.

Closes-Bug: #1761536

Change-Id: I2e08a2de9e4ae8139ab8e4be131631883652d029
(cherry picked from commit a59b4d606fcdf647b89906b437fb4e79d74481ee)

[{'created': '2018-04-30 15:43:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove step_config from CinderVolume backend services

Cinder backends should not repeat the step_config that the CinderVolume
service uses to trigger things in puppet-tripleo. This is benign when
Cinder runs on baremetal, but causes problems when Cinder runs in
containers. It causes the cinder-volume service to run twice, in both
the container as well as on the baremetal host.

Closes-Bug: #1768063
Change-Id: Ie02553f74563883094a13c67a958b15371e90424
'}]
commit_message:
Remove step_config from CinderVolume backend services

Cinder backends should not repeat the step_config that the CinderVolume
service uses to trigger things in puppet-tripleo. This is benign when
Cinder runs on baremetal, but causes problems when Cinder runs in
containers. It causes the cinder-volume service to run twice, in both
the container as well as on the baremetal host.

Closes-Bug: #1768063
Change-Id: Ie02553f74563883094a13c67a958b15371e90424

commit_message:
Add frontend network client support

* Allow to specify frontend network in loadbalancer create.
* Loadbalancer show will now display the frontend network ID.

Depends-On: Ib01518032eaff1abe05bab20021fde09483bda9a
Change-Id: I6d6d32981f7f5c820ca121cd2f835b8fe407688e
Partiallly-Implements: bp l3-active-active

Libvirt now supports this functionality natively, by way of libvirt's 'qemu.conf' configuration file [1] Hurrah! :) As such, this functionality is now available. Given that this option is specific to the libvirt virt driver, I see no reason to expose this option via nova. I've left more detailed comments on the spec [2] but I'm going to reiterate that here by way of a -2. Let me know on IRC (stephenfin) if you disagree with this assessment. We can also discuss at the PTG, if you're in attendance.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/038eb472a0d970a17ccf4343ead0666df5c92f9d
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539605/1"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

if this is done via the qemu.conf then placement needs to be aware of this via a trait and we need to scheduler based on it.

some features such as zero copy rx/tx in vhost required short queue lenghts to work so without a way to request this in nova directly we need to put other logic in placement to model the queue lenght and use traits to enformce it or we will block zero copy enablement going forword.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:33:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> I'm still a little worried about approving the vhostuser driver override because I don't understand it.

What exactly are your worries? I will try to give more details even if I guess you already know all of that, but perhaps that could help.

With virtio-net devices we can have 3 drivers (backends): qemu, vhost and vhostuser. The interface element let you specify which driver you want to use.

Example for an interface element "bridge" you can use qemu or vhost. By default if the driver is not provided libvirt always uses vhost and fallback to qemu if the vhost module is not loaded on the host.

For an interface element "vhostuser" you can actually use only driver vhostuser, libvirt ignores the driver anyway (that is why the current code is working when vhost is set for an vhostuser interface).

Now... You can see me overriding the driver each time. That is because if you look at the 'LibvirtConfigGuestInterface' we add the node driver only if driver_name is set. That driver node is needed to pass the tx/rx queue size attributes. To limit the changes and avoid touching too much. I'm enforcing to use the correct driver.

I hope it's understandable  :) ..and again thanks for your reviews I will address your ask about the unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-13 16:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

2. I think we should strip out the bits of this change that fix the driver=vhostuser for those cases. The assertion is that we're ignoring the fact that it is wrongly vhost today, which is cool, but we should separate that non-functional change from this to make it clear it's not required for this actual change. commit_message:
libvirt: add support for virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes

Add support for configuring the `rx_queue_size` and `tx_queue_size`
options in the virtio-net driver by way of nova.conf

Currently, valid values for the ring buffer sizes are are 256, 512,
and 1024.

Configuring rx requires libvirt v2.3 QEMU v2.7.
Configuring tx requires libvirt v3.7 QEMU v2.10.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nicolas Simonds <nic@metacloud.com>
DocImpact Implements: bp libvirt-virtio-set-queue-sizes
Change-Id: Ib6d4a2d6b9072db42d11ecdde0950cf7a7781944

messages:
[{'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-02-20 21:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-02-20 21:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is the basic skeleton for the OpenStack operations role.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-02-20 22:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2018-02-20 23:18:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Naming nit - I'm not sure if there are formal style guidelines for OpenStack variables but I'd like to see osops* be altered to something more meaningful.

I'd suggest at the minimum to drop the leading 'os', but I'd be much happier with an explicit mention of the 'container' string so that future us has an easy time knowing exactly what this is for.

Additionally, this might be better with workflow set to -1 and WIP stated in the commit message since this is part of a larger endeavour that isn't ready yet, but I'll leave that to @slagle or one of our other mentors to weigh in."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Friendly reminder poke re. var naming as per IRC conversation :-)'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:39:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)

@Alex,

Let's discuss tomorrow at the catchup. :-)"}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-05-01 19:28:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Moving this to its own role repository. See https://github.com/samdoran/ansible-role-openstack-operations'}]

commit_message:
add --count option to let us control what we count

The default is to count contributions, but sometimes we want to know
how many people were involved or other things like that.

Change-Id: I4853f8afc26553d8addf2ada2a5a2adca9e3156c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 04:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Create generic deployment action

Previously we've created an undercloud deploy action for use with the
containerized undercloud. In order to support other deployments that may
not be underclouds, we should rename the interface to something more
generic. This change creates a tripleo deploy action and switches the
undercloud deployment mechanism to leverage the tripleo deployment
action.

The tripleo deployment action has a new parameter called --all-in-one to
indicate if we want to trigger an all-in-one scenario instead of the
default undercloud deployment. Eventually the --all-in-one will become
the default when we remove the undercloud deploy action.

Change-Id: I377b304ad78f54701971c7a29f71d612c62f5dc0
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
Create generic deployment action

Previously we've created an undercloud deploy action for use with the
containerized undercloud. In order to support other deployments that may
not be underclouds, we should rename the interface to something more
generic. This change creates a tripleo deploy action and switches the
undercloud deployment mechanism to leverage the tripleo deployment
action.

The tripleo deployment action has a new parameter called --standalone to
indicate if we want to trigger an standalone deploy scenario. The
undercloud deployment is a special standalone deployment so the existing
undercloud deploy command passes standalone as true to the tripleo
deployment action. Eventually we should roll in the existing overcloud
deployment into this tripleo deploy command to align the two interfaces.

Change-Id: I377b304ad78f54701971c7a29f71d612c62f5dc0
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
undercloud-upgrade: use deploy_steps_tasks for yum update

Use deploy_steps_tasks instead of external_deploy_tasks so we execute
the playbook on nodes that match "overcloud" group, which is the case of
the containerized undercloud.

Also add deploy_steps_tasks to tools/yaml-validate.py part of
OPTIONAL_DOCKER_SECTIONS.

Change-Id: Iaa6a05bf864cdb54a000ef74e6c5ab8e627ab0cf

[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-01 03:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-01 06:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/565400/1/ : SUCCESS in 3h 14m 01s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:20:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm confused why we added another patch for this.  Other than spacing, it's identical to [1].  We should use that one to preserve the history (which is especially interesting in this case).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557958/"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I strongly disagree with the conclusion on that patch regarding making project and user nullable, Eric, which is why I went with a new one.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-01 16:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

rebased on Ed's original.."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 03:54:31.000000000', 'message': "Add generation column to consumers table

In order to prevent races where two different processes can try to write
the allocations for a consumer, we are adding a 'generation' column to
the consumers table. This will be incremented each time a consumer's
allocations change, and allocation requests whose generation doesn't
match the current value will be rejected.

Change-Id: If8e6a7938add417d4e3d9187bf2f40930fe50b85
Co-Authored-By: ed@leafe.com
Blueprint: add-consumer-generation
"}]
commit_message:
Add generation column to consumers table

In order to prevent races where two different processes can try to write
the allocations for a consumer, we are adding a 'generation' column to
the consumers table. This will be incremented each time a consumer's
allocations change, and allocation requests whose generation doesn't
match the current value will be rejected.

Change-Id: If8e6a7938add417d4e3d9187bf2f40930fe50b85
Co-Authored-By: ed@leafe.com
Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
look up affiliations by email domain

When we cannot find the member's record in the foundation database,
use the email address domain to try to find an affiliation.

Change-Id: I4665aa9829373c075cb638326157981ca1251575
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

job for castellan should be run for check and gate tests.

commit_message:
Add configuration option for enforcement models

We eventually want deployers to be able to choose which enforcement
model they want for their deployment. This commit adds a new
configuration options that exposes the enforcement model via config.

This will dictate how project limits are validated.

Change-Id: Ied398b92fef09f3a446960b0757c68a21ba50ed6
Related-Bug: 1765193

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 22:08:26.000000000', 'message': "Add in a STOPSIGNAL configuration

For docker 1.13.1, if STOPSIGNAL is not provided in the docker image,
the container will not automatically restart the container.  It might be
better to define this in the Kolla scripts as a configuration option for
each container, but I'm unsure if it's a problem for any other version
so it might be best to configure this in tripleo until a newer version
of docker is consumed. Additionally I'm not sure if any of the
containers would need something other than STOPSIGNAL SIGTERM which
should be the default if none is provided.

Change-Id: I1939f9e6b2c432a672c7426ddabdcfca6ce150b7
Related-Bug: #1765802
"}]
commit_message:
Add in a STOPSIGNAL configuration

For docker 1.13.1, if STOPSIGNAL is not provided in the docker image,
the container will not automatically restart the container.  It might be
better to define this in the Kolla scripts as a configuration option for
each container, but I'm unsure if it's a problem for any other version
so it might be best to configure this in tripleo until a newer version
of docker is consumed. Additionally I'm not sure if any of the
containers would need something other than STOPSIGNAL SIGTERM which
should be the default if none is provided.

Change-Id: I1939f9e6b2c432a672c7426ddabdcfca6ce150b7
Related-Bug: #1765802

commit_message:
Revert Ceph bridge names to previous values

When the NIC configs were unified under a single role.role.j2.yaml,
the bridge name for Ceph roles was changed from "br-storage" or
"br-bond" to "br-ex". This breaks upgrades which used the original
NIC config templates. This change reverts those valuse when
rendering the NIC config templates for CephStorage roles.

Closes-Bug: #1766748
Change-Id: I68b6e674d6aa86aa7d60efa3eb7b3cb874171e63

commit_message:
use verbose unknown affiliation

We have '*independent' for unaffiliated contributors. Use '*unknown'
when we can't figure out their affiliation.

Change-Id: I724ea924136d3dc652a7c7aec0067cc2ecb2a9e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add layer to canonicalize the organization name

Use some data from stackalytics/etc/default_data.json to build a
canonical mapping of organization aliases to a simplified name.

Add some logic to strip common endings from names to produce simpler
names from variations people often type in and that aren't covered by
the more complex alias data.

Change-Id: Id352d682ff97195f1475aa57b21aaee9caff3f6e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: add an in-memory cache
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-30 20:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-01 16:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-01 17:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 20:44:26.000000000', 'message': 'add an in-memory cache

Processing large data sets with frequent duplication performs better
when we use an in-memory cache to supplement the on-disk cache. The
lru_cache decorator in Python requires all arguments to the decorated
function to be hashable, so this patch converts the existing factory
functions to classes so the fetch() methods can be decorated and still
have access to the underlying cache object.

Change-Id: I1144874e76b5db8fd125679da3a4b5b9ec4540cd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-01 14:58:40.000000000', 'message': 'add an in-memory cache

Processing large data sets with frequent duplication performs better
when we use an in-memory cache to supplement the on-disk cache. The
lru_cache decorator in Python requires all arguments to the decorated
function to be hashable, so this patch converts the existing factory
functions to classes so the fetch() methods can be decorated and still
have access to the underlying cache object.

Change-Id: I1144874e76b5db8fd125679da3a4b5b9ec4540cd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-01 16:11:22.000000000', 'message': 'add an in-memory cache

Processing large data sets with frequent duplication performs better
when we use an in-memory cache to supplement the on-disk cache. The
lru_cache decorator in Python requires all arguments to the decorated
function to be hashable, so this patch converts the existing factory
functions to classes so the fetch() methods can be decorated and still
have access to the underlying cache object.

Change-Id: I1144874e76b5db8fd125679da3a4b5b9ec4540cd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add an in-memory cache

Processing large data sets with frequent duplication performs better
when we use an in-memory cache to supplement the on-disk cache. The
lru_cache decorator in Python requires all arguments to the decorated
function to be hashable, so this patch converts the existing factory
functions to classes so the fetch() methods can be decorated and still
have access to the underlying cache object.

Change-Id: I1144874e76b5db8fd125679da3a4b5b9ec4540cd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

repository as for the rest of Monasca.

'}, {'created': '2018-02-27 11:52:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY to support ssh key content

Currently ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY must be a key file, but in some
cases it's desirable to put the public key content into the
nodepool.yaml file instead of referencing a file that's somehow managed
externally.

This patch makes it possible to set ssh public key through
ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY in environment (e.g. diskimage configuration in
nodepool.yaml).

Change-Id: I83ef3d2e5ff5c3951ecf7036c46d0d8a68871e0c
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Fix ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY to support ssh key content

Currently ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY must be a key file, but
there is no change to create the key file, so it not convenient
for building a image with diskimage-builder, this patch makes
it possible to set ssh public key through ZUUL_USER_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY
in envirement(e.g. diskimage configuration in nodepool.yaml  ).

Change-Id: I83ef3d2e5ff5c3951ecf7036c46d0d8a68871e0c
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Add a status check for enabled filters

The FilterScheduler has been calling the Placement API since Ocata for
compute node resource providers with available VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB
resource class inventory.

In Ocata, we added a release note explaining that if the legacy Core,
Disk and RAM filters are not enabled, operators should change their
allocation ratios.

This change adds a nova-status upgrade check method for helping to
warn operators if they need to check their config before upgrading.

Change-Id: Ib226faa912c03235f998d8312a0d3d13a5bbc8d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 14:30:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes HA Proxy backend check for ODL

This patch removed listen_options for ODL:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562036/

Which introduced a regression where default options were then applied
for ODL, including httpchk.  This does not work with ODL because ODL
will not respond to an HTTP GET without specific paths used.  This patch
adds the correct path that may be used to issue HTTP backend check.

Closes-Bug: 1768037

Change-Id: I60bdfc436044851ac02449c262d382b07b888f79
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-04-30 15:29:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes HA Proxy backend check for ODL

This patch removed listen_options for ODL:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562036/

Which introduced a regression where default options were then applied
for ODL, including httpchk.  This does not work with ODL because ODL
will not respond to an HTTP GET without specific paths used.  This patch
adds the correct path that may be used to issue HTTP backend check.

Closes-Bug: 1768037

Change-Id: I60bdfc436044851ac02449c262d382b07b888f79
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes HA Proxy backend check for ODL

This patch removed listen_options for ODL:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562036/

Which introduced a regression where default options were then applied
for ODL, including httpchk.  This does not work with ODL because ODL
will not respond to an HTTP GET without specific paths used.  This patch
adds the correct path that may be used to issue HTTP backend check.

Closes-Bug: 1768037

Change-Id: I60bdfc436044851ac02449c262d382b07b888f79
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove empty host prep tasks for Tempest

There is no task, so we don't need this config, which leads to Ansible
error if a task is empty.

Change-Id: I8ca0d6f012e3bac68d052df117366d816c2b9cb6
Closes-Bug: #1768019

commit_message:
Add heartbeat() method to RpcIncomingMessage

This adds a heartbeat() method to RpcIncomingMessage to be used by a
subsequent patch implementation of active-call heartbeating. This is
unimplemented in all drivers for the moment.

Change-Id: If8ab0dc16e3bef69d5a826c31c0fe35e403ac6a1

Are you sure that the current test verifies this? I've some doubt"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

i think it just verifies that the method is called with right parameters. it doesn't actually verify it's stored in db.

maybe fix this test so it actually verifies what you did reflects in db correctly."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > 
nm, that test works because it tests path where you change alarm via API, which currently sets severity correctly.

ideally, i would add a test to https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/aodh/tests/functional/storage/test_storage_scenarios.py to verify results of update_alarm'}, {'account_id': 25891, 'date': '2018-02-26 09:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25891, 'date': '2018-02-27 01:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 09:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'add "severity" value for alarm_history

alarm_history table has a field "severity",but aodh-evaluator service's
_record_service() function in /aodh/evaluator/__init__.py lack this

commit_message:
add "severity" value for alarm_history

alarm_history table has a field "severity",but aodh-evaluator service's
_record_service() function in /aodh/evaluator/__init__.py lack this
field.So this bug caused "severity" field in alarm_history is NULL.

Change-Id: Ifd9f7b2fa9101ecbb6084dc363d7a14d3e67fed6
Closes-Bug: #1745946

commit_message:
Move libvirt-fake-nodepool vars to roles

Playbooks should not contain al the vars needed
to run a role.
This review moves the vars to a file that is
included when the playbook libvirt-fake-nodepool.yml
is run.

The playbook is also renamed in this review to
match the role it runs.

Change-Id: I7aee31f3dbfc7310b964cd56357f8d7a7cda0f7a

commit_message:
Create keypair for SSH access to Octavia amphorae

Create keypair from a given public key file under the project name for
Octavia ('service' by default). If a public key file is not provided,
the public key of the undercloud stack user will be used.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560879/
Change-Id: I3b2e283f6fa081b07cc12a244c14701e431d884e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 19:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Automatically expire obsolete relationships""

This reverts commit a75014792aeda0851510531919d040090e1aec15.

This is the second attempt to merge the patch after the previous one resulted
in revert due to multiple gate breakages in dependent projects (neutron-lbaas,
vmware-nsx, heat, networking-odl). This second attempt is validated with a set
of depends-on patches for all projects that were affected during the first
failed attempt.

The original commit message for the patch is included below for context.

===

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I0d65d19204da8ce30addfa5faff68544534b7853
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 22:00:22.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Automatically expire obsolete relationships""

This reverts commit a75014792aeda0851510531919d040090e1aec15.

This is the second attempt to merge the patch after the previous one resulted
in revert due to multiple gate breakages in dependent projects (neutron-lbaas,
vmware-nsx, heat, networking-odl). This second attempt is validated with a set
of depends-on patches for all projects that were affected during the first
failed attempt.

The original commit message for the patch is included below for context.

===

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Depends-On: If4b28110f460f6ac77ace1bbb02967ea986d4cab
Change-Id: I0d65d19204da8ce30addfa5faff68544534b7853
'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 14:27:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Automatically expire obsolete relationships""

This reverts commit a75014792aeda0851510531919d040090e1aec15.

This is the second attempt to merge the patch after the previous one resulted
in revert due to multiple gate breakages in dependent projects (neutron-lbaas,
vmware-nsx, heat, networking-odl). This second attempt is validated with a set
of depends-on patches for all projects that were affected during the first
failed attempt.

The original commit message for the patch is included below for context.

===

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Automatically expire obsolete relationships""

This reverts commit a75014792aeda0851510531919d040090e1aec15.

This is the second attempt to merge the patch after the previous one resulted
in revert due to multiple gate breakages in dependent projects (neutron-lbaas,
vmware-nsx, heat, networking-odl). This second attempt is validated with a set
of depends-on patches for all projects that were affected during the first
failed attempt.

The original commit message for the patch is included below for context.

===

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Depends-On: If4b28110f460f6ac77ace1bbb02967ea986d4cab
Depends-On: I9f1e76cb24838533572b5fbe269ff96a24ce4af1
Change-Id: I0d65d19204da8ce30addfa5faff68544534b7853
