[{'created': '2018-04-30 13:08:35.000000000', 'message': 'Drop bogus attributes from network port resource

In [0] some attributes were added to the port resource that do not
exist in the API at the top level. They only appear as sub-attributes
in objects returned for other attributes. Remove them again as they
lead to useless output when doing e.g. "openstack port show".

[0] I728ff349811e344396176d1c577cef653350bfdb

Change-Id: I4bc81d13519ff4014b3a5b1ccff2771c533d2a45
'}]
commit_message:
Drop bogus attributes from network port resource

In [0] some attributes were added to the port resource that do not
exist in the API at the top level. They only appear as sub-attributes
in objects returned for other attributes. Remove them again as they
lead to useless output when doing e.g. "openstack port show".

[0] I728ff349811e344396176d1c577cef653350bfdb

Change-Id: I4bc81d13519ff4014b3a5b1ccff2771c533d2a45

subject: add code to fetch individual reviews and wrap the results
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-30 20:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 20:44:26.000000000', 'message': 'add code to fetch individual reviews and wrap the results

Wrap the raw json with a data class that has properties so we don't
have to spread knowledge of the JSON format all over.

The request and response parsing code is taken from the elections repo
"owner.py" module.

Change-Id: I5013e7c89f550d385beb99cdc6f2ae2f1af38d64
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add code to fetch individual reviews and wrap the results

Wrap the raw json with a data class that has properties so we don't
have to spread knowledge of the JSON format all over.

The request and response parsing code is taken from the elections repo
"owner.py" module.

Change-Id: I5013e7c89f550d385beb99cdc6f2ae2f1af38d64
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Set repo build pip default mirror when in openstack-ci

When in openstack-ci we should use the most local pypi mirror
available for the repo build process to speed things up.

Change-Id: I9e6c209bafa21afe22e0c4f67da584d553a50e00
(cherry picked from commit aac7e8ce1864dd1db0d8fb6008d20e62f2b5a38a)

subject: Release xstatic-angular-notify 2.5.1.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 8648, 'name': 'Radomir Dopieralski', 'email': 'openstack@dopieralski.pl', 'username': 'thesheep'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 19224, 'name': 'Xinni Ge', 'email': 'xinni.ge1990@gmail.com', 'username': 'irisayame'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 19224, 'date': '2018-04-05 02:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-06 03:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I noticed that xstatic-angular-notify repo converted CSS from the upstream repo to SCSS file. In my understanding xstatic packages are to distribute static files using python packaging mechanism as-is. I don't know it is appropriate to replace CSS with SCSS.

(Note that this is not directly related to a release itself, so I don't put -1 on this change.)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Release looks fine, but not sure on that last comment. Will need a +1 from Ivan or Akihiro.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

xstatic packages should release upstream files as they are, without modifications specific to our project -- we might not be the only consumers of them in the future.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It looks better to fix it in xstatic-angular-notify repo before releasing it.
We would like to check other new xstatic repos too.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-25 12:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any update on these Xinni?'}, {'account_id': 19224, 'date': '2018-04-26 02:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for taking it so long. Just need a little more time to update xstatic repo and update this patch with new hash string for release.'}, {'account_id': 19224, 'date': '2018-05-01 04:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Change-Id: Ia3bc5ac16e2304393d671eaccb763bf83d9c1804
'}, {'created': '2018-05-01 04:34:08.000000000', 'message': 'Release xstatic-angular-notify 2.5.1.0

Change-Id: Ia3bc5ac16e2304393d671eaccb763bf83d9c1804

subject: Change libvirt-nodepool to use both internal and external DNS
messages: [{'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-01 13:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nIncluded in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565280'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 13:54:47.000000000', 'message': 'Change libvirt-nodepool to use both internal and external DNS

Previously, we had used the supersede option which replaced
the internal DNS server with the external one.
Testers on different systems requires more DNS server options
and this review uses the append option to achieve that.

Change-Id: Id64480b1c4680af76e200719f96868d939e271d4
'}]
commit_message:
Change libvirt-nodepool to use both internal and external DNS

Previously, we had used the supersede option which replaced
the internal DNS server with the external one.
Testers on different systems requires more DNS server options
and this review uses the append option to achieve that.

Change-Id: Id64480b1c4680af76e200719f96868d939e271d4

commit_message:
Get rid of a extra copy of workflow environment

* Previously, we had two copies of the workflow environment
  passed by a user: one was in the 'params' fields under ke 'env'
  key and another one was copied into the 'context' field under
  the '__env' key so that we can evaluate expressions involving
  the env() function (YAQL or Jinja).
  This patch removes the copy from the 'context' field in favor
  of using an ad-hoc ContextView structure where we now also
  weave in the environment dictionary under the same key '__env'.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I1204b082794b376787d126136a79dd204ec3af07

commit_message:
Introduce docker_insecure_registries parameter

Introduce docker_insecure_registries that is an array of host/port
combiniations of docker insecure registries. The default value will
be the previous parameter that were hardcoded, but now we can easily
override it in undercloud.conf.

Note: the feature is already supported for the containerized undercloud
but was only missing in instack-undercloud. This patch will be
backported.

Depends-On: I14fda3481ac88429648bed8edb2f4469b33be957
Change-Id: I402ebb80b1d755cdb0c3c28fd542121bc60cb144
Closes-Bug: #1767373

commit_message:
Enable GRE conntrack

When using colocating swift-storage and neutron-openvswitch, GRE
traffic is marked INVALID. Need to modprobe nf_conntrack_proto_gre to
fix.

Fix is in charm-helpers. Please merge CH first:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/139

Change-Id: I9e60d5f2b874842906f2ccd67374af12a9cd2a10
Closes-Bug: #1757564

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/561407/5/ : FAILURE in 4h 43m 14s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-26 05:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17333 : FAILURE in 1h 55m 33s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-26 10:45:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Yeah, I may be in the minority on this, but I'm really not feeling it. This implementation feels like overengineering and non-stepwise. What we need, _now_, is a table of consumer id and generation pairs and some sql that uses that table in the existing places where allocations are managed. The allocation object gains a consumer generation field to go along with the existing project and user id fields.

The Allocation object data is then written to the various data tables as needed.

If _later_ we need to expose the concept of consumers at the API level we can refactor but horning that concept in now is dragging in a lot of complexity and obscuring the relative simplicity of what we are trying to do now which is simply this:

* each incoming set of allocation might have a generation associated with it, if it does, make sure it is the same as what's already in the database, if it's not, conflict
* once done writing the set of allocations for the consumer, increment the stored generation, if and only if it is (still) equal to the stored, if not, conflict

(modulo a few details of course)"}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-05-01 13:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No longer using Consumer objects.'}]

commit_message:
Add Consumer objects to Allocations

This patch adds the Consumer object as a field in the Allocation object.
It doesn't do anything with it in this patch; that will be added later.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I1109f130b5240dded1787a6233d8f3c9af4fce8e

(5 comments)

There are some errors noted within. That's what the -1 is for.

But on top of that, in a -0 kind of way, I really think trying to do stuff within the object is complicating things a great deal and not in keeping with the way we are managing data elsewhere in the same file. Using the object as a convenient way to contain some data is fine, but I don't think we want to be using save() or increment on the object directly. Those are things that should be happening in a more imperative fashion. I suspect my thoughts on this will become a bit more clear as I move further through the stack.

To put it another way: all this consumer object is doing, for me, is confusing me."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-26 11:02:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Add the Consumer object

This patch adds the Consumer object to placement, representing the
consumer of resources. The logic for checking generations is there, but
is not called yet; that will be added in a later patch.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I39947fe5e47bb3476ebebcba3ca2cb35dc727ea7

commit_message:
Fix linters in role and make them fit oooq rules

Add linter rule with pipefail when using shell module
and pipe.
Fix linter issues in role - pipefail for shell.
See also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564472/

Change-Id: Ie615b05dffc374972a8f3629485a4413e85d331d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:52:35.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks

At present the Libvirt driver can preallocate file based disks using the
fallocate command and importantly the `-n` option. This option allocates
blocks on the filesystem past the initial EOF of a given file:

```
$ touch test.img ; fallocate -n -l $(( 1024 * 1024 )) test.img
$ ll -lah test.img
-rw-rw-r--. 1 stack stack 0 Apr 16 13:28 test.img
$ du -h test.img
1.0M	test.img
```

This results in a miscalculation of the total disk overcommit for file
based (excluding ploop) disks as os.path.getsize is currently used to
determine the allocated size of these disks:

```
>>> import os
>>> os.path.getsize('test.img')
0
```

Using the above example the disk overcommit would be reported as 1.0M as
the disk appears empty yet will report a potential (virtual) size of 1.0M.

However as the required blocks have already been allocated on the
filesystem the host will report disk_available_least as missing an
additional 1.0M, essentially doubling the allocation for each disk.

To correct this the allocated size of file based (excluding ploop) disks
is reported using `disk_size` from the `qemu-img info` command. This
should ensure blocks allocated past the EOF of the file are taken into
account and correctly reported as allocated.

A future change should ultimately remove the use of the `-n` option with
fallocate, however as this would not help disks that have already been
allocated this has not been included in this change to simplify backports.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): I11e329ac5f5fe4b9819fefbcc32ff1ee504fc58b made
get_domain private in Queens.

Change-Id: If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594
Closes-bug: #1764489
(cherry picked from commit 23bd8f62634707fc9896a38ff4dae606c89c6c4b)
(cherry picked from commit 2d50f6e7854543849c4cb7641ae6b88fe04cb6f6)
(cherry picked from commit d88b75e81eabfbd463007f6a4f27e6966a466530)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks

At present the Libvirt driver can preallocate file based disks using the
fallocate command and importantly the `-n` option. This option allocates
blocks on the filesystem past the initial EOF of a given file:

```
$ touch test.img ; fallocate -n -l $(( 1024 * 1024 )) test.img
$ ll -lah test.img
-rw-rw-r--. 1 stack stack 0 Apr 16 13:28 test.img
$ du -h test.img
1.0M	test.img
```

This results in a miscalculation of the total disk overcommit for file
based (excluding ploop) disks as os.path.getsize is currently used to
determine the allocated size of these disks:

```
>>> import os
>>> os.path.getsize('test.img')
0
```

Using the above example the disk overcommit would be reported as 1.0M as
the disk appears empty yet will report a potential (virtual) size of 1.0M.

However as the required blocks have already been allocated on the
filesystem the host will report disk_available_least as missing an
additional 1.0M, essentially doubling the allocation for each disk.

To correct this the allocated size of file based (excluding ploop) disks
is reported using `disk_size` from the `qemu-img info` command. This
should ensure blocks allocated past the EOF of the file are taken into
account and correctly reported as allocated.

A future change should ultimately remove the use of the `-n` option with
fallocate, however as this would not help disks that have already been
allocated this has not been included in this change to simplify backports.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): I11e329ac5f5fe4b9819fefbcc32ff1ee504fc58b made
get_domain private in Queens.

Change-Id: If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594
Closes-bug: #1764489
(cherry picked from commit 23bd8f62634707fc9896a38ff4dae606c89c6c4b)
(cherry picked from commit 2d50f6e7854543849c4cb7641ae6b88fe04cb6f6)
(cherry picked from commit d88b75e81eabfbd463007f6a4f27e6966a466530)

commit_message:
inventory: uses a var to simplify the logic

This patch introduces the use the `virthost_with_private_key` variable to
avoid long condition in the playbook and the Jinja2 template.
It also improves the test to cover the case where the virthost group is
not defined in the inventory.

Change-Id: Ifb925f4a72cf97cfab91944f2dba87033bf1d376

commit_message:
Add editor dirs to .gitignore

.vs/     - visual studio
.vscode/ - visual studio code
.idea/   - jetbrains (all)

.venv/ --> .venv* (allow for multiple venv's)

Change-Id: I9fbed032235d6adc7fcee6a0e31ce6249f83f5e0

commit_message:
Adjust roles-data file for P->Q upgrade.

As described in rhbz-1540546 and rhbz-1541382 services available
 during P deployment got renamed/removed in Q.
This change modifies custom roles-data file wrt aforementioned
 changes.

Partial-Bug: 1708680
Partial-Bug: 1746493

Depends-On: I9b488d84fa6e86ed9ce03c7b5fda5d42f713724d
Change-Id: I8dc672d3b909afc781c3f62a77c16aa1445bec40
(cherry picked from commit 67aa778890f5f3e203f9278f5bf71172c2931ca0)

and hostname for undercloud in tripleo client.

commit_message:
Tidy charts

This patch set tidies up the existing charts. Fixes include:

* add release_group key in yaml
* fix indentation inconsistency issue
* clean up the ldap chart's value.yaml to be consistent with mariaDB

Change-Id: Ibd9d86603ebc6c6c31c596dc0af523eb71c083d0
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Update quickstart base centos image.

This purposed change will bring the base qcow2 image up to date and
include a few system updates to correct various deployment issues.

Change-Id: Iff761e28f078ad833a4a6ab17079e566f5b95cf1

Remove DNS servers that are no longer used

For RDO Cloud we use - and maintain only the
the first of the DNS servers listed. This review
removes the other servers listed.

Change-Id: I36a8c6a83e808298997bb93755425f902f5f7324

commit_message:
Revert role freeze and update openstack_release for Rocky m2

In order to continue testing from the head of the role repositories
to prepare for milestone 2, we revert the role freeze and set the
release to 18.0.0.0b2

Change-Id: I35b2eef362a0a53f2236cd2dab11778e44c85d48

[{'created': '2018-04-25 18:53:02.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Deprecate os_region_name option"

This reverts commit b8e0b4a74168e91704044f9546388cecd6d8e40b.

When testing, it appears that nova-compute cannot start if region_name is
set, and os_region_name isn't. At least, this happened to me using Debian
Stretch, and probably this also affects other distros.

Change-Id: I1cc43f091a10ddc42b9d880d5058aee4e82a8873
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate os_region_name option"

This reverts commit b8e0b4a74168e91704044f9546388cecd6d8e40b.

When testing, it appears that nova-compute cannot start if region_name is
set, and os_region_name isn't. At least, this happened to me using Debian
Stretch, and probably this also affects other distros.

Change-Id: I1cc43f091a10ddc42b9d880d5058aee4e82a8873

Thanks Rodrigo Barbieri'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2018-04-08 02:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-04-09 13:18:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(19 comments)

Hi Zhongjun, 

Please see comments inline. I think there are some open questions around this feature. Can you please clarify if the priority of access rules is necessary for anything apart from IP rules for an NFS share? Does priority make sense for CIFS/CEPHFS/MapR/Gluster user rules? 

If it only makes sense to the NFS drivers, and there are existing drivers (NetApp) that implement the "correct" re-ordering scheme (making sure individual addresses always sort higher than the subnets they are part of, and smaller subnets always sort above larger subnets) - why don't we extend this scheme to core manila and make all NFS drivers behave the same way?

Network devices do this sort of thing all the time, and I think we can think of an efficient way of sorting and handing down rules to drivers and documenting this behavior for the benefit of the users. 

Besides semantic "correctness", I don't see any other use case mentioned in this spec. Please correct me if this is wrong.'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2018-04-10 04:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

@Goutham: there is no "correct" way to reorder rules today. NetApp chose a way, but it may be contrary to what the user wanted. Priorities allow us to do exactly what the user tells us and removes the need to guess what the user intended.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-04-11 07:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-04-12 11:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

"Can you please clarify if the priority of access rules is necessary for anything apart from IP rules for an NFS share? Does priority make sense for CIFS/CEPHFS/MapR/Gluster user rules? "


--- It only makes sense for access rules which could possibly overlap. Which would include anything that uses IP-based access. Perhaps user-based access doesn't need priorities. Although with groups, one could imagine overlap with user-based access too. so, if the MapR user rules don't need it, they don't need to use the priority parameter when they create a access rule.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks Goutham Pacha Ravi'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-04-16 19:45:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Although with groups, one could imagine overlap with user-based access too. so, if the MapR user rules don't need it, they don't need to use the priority parameter when they create a access rule.

Can you add this to the spec, please? This should go into the problem description for consideration of this feature."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-04-16 22:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Thanks Goutham Pacha Ravi'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-04-18 17:12:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Jun,

Thanks for your work on this important issue!

That said, I'm not convinced that we've found the best approach to the ambiguous rule set issue yet, for the following reasons:
 
1) Do priorities also apply to denies?  If so, what do they mean?  If not, what do you plan to do in api, client, and UI for denies?  This isn't an insurmountable issue probably but manila 'denies' (which are deletes) make use of priorities more awkward than, perhaps, than the way they are used in alibaba cloud.

2) Note that while assigning priorities *allows* a user to disambiguate it does not *ensure* that the user actually does so.  Nothing prevents rule sets like:

   A 192.168.1.0/24 ro priority 3
   A 192.168.1.0/16 rw priority 3

and this is still ambiguous.  Do addresses within 192.168.1.0/24 get ro or rw access?

3) Some backends may not be able to implement rule sets like

   A 192.168.1.0/16 ro priority 1
   A 192.168.1.0/24 rw priority 3

In the last community meeting this rule set was interpreted as requiring ead only semantics for all IPs in 192.168.1.0/16 CIDR so that the second rule has no effect. The second rule would sill stay around so that later if the /16 rule is removed the /24 rw rule will take effect.  At least that was the interpretation given by those who favor the priority rules.  But a back end that has most-specific-match semantics instead of first-match-semantics will not be able to do this in any natural way.

The only solution I can come up with that will yield a clean solution for first-rule, last-rule, and most-specific-rule back ends is for the manager to sort most-specific first.  First-rule and most-specific-rule back ends will then have the same effective semantics and last-rule back ends can simply reverse the sort before processing.

If we do that then (1) we don't need users to assign priorities, (2) we don't have to worry about whether 'denies' get assigned priorities or not, and (3) ambiguities will be resolved for all rule sets, deterministically.

We would need to agree whether denies should be sorted first or last but we need to face that issue anyways I think."}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Published edit on patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(4 comments)

Thanks Tom!

2) Note that while assigning priorities *allows* a user to disambiguate it does not *ensure* that the user actually does so.  Nothing prevents rule sets like:

   A 192.168.1.0/24 ro priority 3
   A 192.168.1.0/16 rw priority 3

and this is still ambiguous.  Do addresses within 192.168.1.0/24 get ro or rw access?

-- Added in spec (line 255~231) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552935/13/specs/rocky/priority-for-access-rules.rst@225

3) Some backends may not be able to implement rule sets like

   A 192.168.1.0/16 ro priority 1
   A 192.168.1.0/24 rw priority 3

-- Is there a driver cannot support above roles?'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Id29497b36cd2b9cca3f3b08474e1001d528931b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Delegate database tasks to galera_server

With the implementation of [1] the MySQL-python package is
no longer present on the service container. Given that all
other services have the playbook execute these tasks with
delegation to the first galera_server container, we can do
that here too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562276

Change-Id: I2c70ac1324ea027ae4a8ed1e70c5706b47fcd57f

commit_message:
Make sure microversion < 2.62 does not show host(Id) for instance actions

This adds a simple assertion that when microversion < 2.62, the
"nova instance-action" CLI does not show host or hostId output.

Related to blueprint add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: I6e0866d9daff75046a5e82f57ff745d494b4b5ed

[{'created': '2018-04-30 21:22:15.000000000', 'message': "Make DNS pod autoscale

DNS service is a very critical service in k8s world, though it's not
a part of k8s itself. So it would be nice to have it replicate more
than 1 and on differents nodes to have high availbility. Otherwise,
services running on k8s cluster will be broken if the node contains
DNS pod down. Another sample is, when user would like to do a cluster
upgrade, services will be borken when the node containers DNS pod
being replaced. You can find lots of discussion about this, please
refer [1],[2] and [3].

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/issues/128
[2] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/40063
[3] https://github.com/kubernetes/kops/issues/2693

(cherry picked from commit 54a4ac9f8453716d84150d4fe0b88e65dba24fbf)
"}]
commit_message:
Make DNS pod autoscale

DNS service is a very critical service in k8s world, though it's not
a part of k8s itself. So it would be nice to have it replicate more
than 1 and on differents nodes to have high availbility. Otherwise,
services running on k8s cluster will be broken if the node contains
DNS pod down. Another sample is, when user would like to do a cluster
upgrade, services will be borken when the node containers DNS pod
being replaced. You can find lots of discussion about this, please
refer [1],[2] and [3].

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/issues/128
[2] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/40063
[3] https://github.com/kubernetes/kops/issues/2693

Closes-Bug: #1757554

Change-Id: Ic64569d4bdcf367955398d5badef70e7afe33bbb
(cherry picked from commit 54a4ac9f8453716d84150d4fe0b88e65dba24fbf)

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Add admin user

Add an admin service account and give it the
cluster role. It can be used for access apps
with token authentication like the
kubernetes-dashboard.

Remove the cluster role from the dashboard service account.

Change-Id: I7980c0e72b0d71921e42af7338d02b8a1e563c34
Closes-Bug: #1766284
(cherry picked from commit 91d5229b9c0e083cae60a8dc3e546145a82c7f93)

commit_message:
Enable iPXE boot in ironic

a new variable, kolla_enable_ironic_ipxe is added to control whether or not
iPXE is used as the network boot program in ironic. You can set this is in
etc/kayobe/kolla.yml, e.g:

  kolla_enable_ironic_ipxe: True

Change-Id: I206b68097f2636b8462b0e4e30590bc6c1494960

Changing the existing webhook trigger API requires a new microversion:

Also, existing documentation on the webhook trigger needs to be changed where necessary,
e.g.: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/clustering/#id250'}, {'account_id': 25138, 'date': '2018-04-27 23:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-04-28 01:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thank you very much for the patch. Your considerations on changing API doc, history along with the code and the effort on making changes backward compatible are highly appreciated!'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-04-28 17:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Make webhook API compatible with Aodh

Currently Aodh alarms will send their params as part of the body, rather
than nested inside of a 'params' field. I asked Aodh to change how
they are sending this but they suggested I change this API instead.
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564648/

Change-Id: I140826f8433535281a60480bd10391f3f95a0d66

commit_message:
Add an openshift-cns service

This service file allows for enabling CNS in an OpenShift deployment.
It works as a tagging service and the rest of the configs are applied in
the openshift-master service file.

Note that the disks used can be specified as follows:

parameter_defaults:
  OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
    - /dev/sdb

Or per-role like:

parameter_defaults:
  OpenShiftMasterParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/sdb
  OpenShiftWorkerParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/sdc

Change-Id: I92972d89ee7edf2ff211e88c6e0758628c3018a2

commit_message:
Add ansible linter rule for set pipefail

When using pipes in ansible shell module we can miss the error
because shell is executing without pipefail by default.
This rule will check every shell module if it has "set -e pipefail"
and will fail in case if not.
It excludes tasks which have 'ignore_errors: true' or register
variables.

Change-Id: I394c72040d62dff76180aeb9d703bb8a212bcc98

commit_message:
Define Octavia SSH key name and file path

This will enable Octavia Ansible roles in tripleo-common to get these
values and configure keys for accessing Octavia amphorae via SSH.

This patch also makes the Octavia username and project name
configurable.

Change-Id: I80aa324254e6837e8d3c39e9d05a5e152783f0bb
(cherry picked from commit 38eee383e52fa6e406c75f1e74b95493a10e54f8)

[{'created': '2018-04-09 12:41:40.000000000', 'message': 'Removing the deprecated environment files for hw offloading in containers

For deploying with hw offloading in containers, we should use the
ovs-hw-offload.yaml file with neutron, opendaylight and ovn.
In case of "ovn" deployment we need also:

commit_message:
Removing the deprecated environment files for hw offloading in containers

For deploying with hw offloading in containers, we should use the
ovs-hw-offload.yaml file with neutron, opendaylight and ovn.
In case of "ovn" deployment we need also:
"environments/services-docker/neutron-ovn.yaml"
and in case of "opendaylight" we need:
"environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml"

Change-Id: Ic844466954cde3b7206ab6a209ded6abb1acbbf6

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: If3f1960d5c2c7734cf50c8fa779487d582683187

commit_message:
Add www_authenticate_uri option to replace auth_uri.

auth_uri option has been depreacted in
favor of www_authenticate_uri from group
keystone_authtoken in puppet-keystone [0]
and keystonemiddleware [1].

This patch adds the new option keeping auth_uri
references in the templates until the replace
will be updated in all puppet packages.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558344/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Closes-Bug: #1761171
Change-Id: I804ec73b970844d245dbb0911710ec817359beb0

[{'created': '2018-04-19 20:12:50.000000000', 'message': 'Set live_migration_inbound_addr for all live migration transports

Currently this is only set when TLS is enabled, which means that with the ssh

hosts file to be correct, which is not guaranteed (especially with DNS).

commit_message:
Set live_migration_inbound_addr for ssh transport

Currently this is only set when TLS is enabled, which means that with the ssh
transport we cannot control the network used, and we are relying on DNS or
hosts file to be correct, which is not guaranteed (especially with DNS).

Related-Bug: 1765462
Depends-On: Ifdc5fbd05195604ab6ea6564d0905f9385c6df67
Change-Id: I89011d06233dafb5ca3bbb45431387ebda521711

commit_message:
undercloud-upgrade: deploy n-1 first then upgrade

The current undercloud upgrade job deploys an undercloud from master so
upgrade was never actually tested. This patch finds out which release we
want to test and provide the right featureset file.

Co-authored-by: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3c9d2396988bd3125740f0054c66e8243e85f437

commit_message:
Remove Fujitsu static config table

The Fujitsu driver docs describe their config options without the
need of a config table. This removes unnecessary reference to the
static table.

Change-Id: I699ba5b9a1d37c99b53b73b6e732b98e7089ffe4

Looks good to me in general, but might be good to ask why this isn't a feature of oslo.db? I am sure other projects might benefit from a similar construct. Tagged Doug as he might have some feedback.

Removed WIP'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-01 00:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-01 03:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-05-01 06:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Make db retry parameters into a config option

This patch makes max_retries, retry_interval, max_retry_interval a
config option for all db functions. Additionally this patch replaces all
occurances of oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry with retry_on_deadlock.

This is to help with people who need to retry more/less depending
on their database constraints. Any input on this patch would be
much appreciated. The retry logic that implemented
oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry had different max_retries and retry_interval
any explnation as to why would be helpful also.

Change-Id: I2b6a19fac60604a7f5bfd7f3f9c198e84efe41f3

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop BAD_LIBVIRT_NUMA_VERSIONS

It was added / modified in the following commits

    7ca5610 (libvirt: Disable NUMA for broken libvirt)
    9efd470 (libvirt: log when BAD_LIBVIRT_NUMA_VERSIONS detected)

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

Change-Id: Ie6bb51e5794409840525bf3a927ac451eb9643c1
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
